results.description:
This website is a place for you and other like-minded Americans with the basic values and principles that made this country great.  All are welcome here. The 9-12 Project is designed to bring us all back to the place we were on September 12, 2001. The day after America was attacked we were not obsessed with Red States, Blue States or political parties. We were united as Americans, standing together to protect the greatest nation ever created.

This is a non-political movement but we will explore the political parties, platforms, rhetoric and deciding what helps or hurts the country. With that, we hope that you will view candidates based upon their principles rather than their party. Parties have done nothing but separate our great nation. Divided we fall but united we will stand! Let us find our common ground and stand united once more! The foundation and common ground of this group should be based upon our United States Constitution, Bill of Rights and the Federalist papers . These are the foundation that our country was built on.

We believe that our members should be as self sufficient as possible and to that end we will teach each other about emergency preparedness.  We will also on occasions teach others some of the skills that we have learned.

We encourage and allow open, positively presented discussion about The 912 Project. There are NINE PRINCIPLES and 12 VALUES.

Here is the 912 Project "Headquarters".... http://www.the912project.com/

Notes:
**I am not a professional moderator or organizer.
**I do believe we collectively need to help change the direction the country is heading and I personally want to be involved.
**If you are interested in this group and would like additional information I will try to answer your questions.

Some IMPORTANT NOTES:

NOTES ON JOINING: Refer to THE 912 PROJECT for the details of what this is all about if you have doubts. If your goal is to contribute and engage constructively, debate intelligently, and be active, we welcome you. If it is your goal to serve a particular party or be disruptive or divisive in ANY WAY, please look elsewhere. If you join and do that or do not honor the intent of the project, you will be disenrolled.

NOTES ON MESSAGE BOARD POSTS: The moderator will not tolerate name calling, verbally abusive language, and attempts to degrade legitimate discussions on the message boards. Behavior of that kind means the writer can no longer engage in intelligent, civil debate. Please refrain from and report such abuses. Offenders will be given one warning and a second chance. Repeat offenders will be dropped from the group.

NOTES ON SOLICITATIONS: NO SOLICITING MEMBERS! If you should choose to make that mistake, I cannot be responsible for the actions of several of our VERY tech savvy members. I understand that SPAM en masse can be horrible.
results.name: Central Maryland 912 Project

results.description:
We hope this introduction finds you well or at least on the road to well.

If the later, or if you’re still looking for that road, or especially if you’re thinking, “What stinking road?” know that you are not alone. Through this group and participation in activities to come, you’ll find a community of fellow and former travelers and supporters that can help. And not just with finding the road, but with negotiating the inevitable bumps, detours and fender benders you’ll experience along the way.

Life eventually gets better. It is our hope that your participation in the group will help with that process. Let’s Meetup!


Patrick

Save Money, Time and Heartache.
Mediate, Don't Litigate Your Divorce.

P.S.  Anyone on the road to finding forward is welcome to become a member.  If you would prefer not to be a member with your ex/soon to be ex, please do a quick check of member profiles by join date back to the date of your separation to determine if your ex/soon to be ex is (or may) already be a member.  If you are still unsure, give us a full name and we’ll confirm for you.
results.name: Finding Forward: A DC Metro Separation/Divorce Support Group

results.description:
Enjoy reading brainy books?  Classics of world literature?  Philosophy? Something entertaining, yet intellectually stimulating?  Do you actually CHOOSE to pick up novels by the likes of E.M. Forster, D.H. Lawrence, Emily Bronte, or maybe Toni Morrison?  Does exploring philosophical classics (Plato's Symposium, maybe? Sartre? Hume?) actually appeal to you? 

If reading great literature with a friendly, laid-back, edgy intellectual crowd turns you on, then this is the meetup for you.  We won't take ourselves or anything TOO seriously, but we will delve into some fantastic books, talk about them, discuss, debate, learn, etc.  And we will have fun. 

It's OKAY to be into this kind of thing.  Promise.

results.description:
Classical music is like a box of chocolate. Not every composer or piece is for everyone. So dive in, sample a few and you may just find a new way to relax.
Many people think of classical music as an acquired taste. We "acquire" tastes for all kinds of music without realising it such as country, pop, raggea,and jazz but most people considers classical music difficult to appreciate. It is really quite a diverse field of music and there is a wide variety of classical styles.
 Meet other Classical musicians to practice and make music together. our space is large . Classical music is stimulating and contributes to cultural diversity. it's always nice to get together for this kind of music. this group is for Classical, Jazz and Blues We encourage adult musicians, especially pianists, to join. Beginners to advanced. Play a classical, blues, jazz or your own composition in a relaxed setting. Encourage members to play with other members, i.e., piano four hands or combinations of other instruments. We wish to reintroduce the practice of Hausmusik, house music, that is, music played by non-professionals or by professionals just for the fun of it. We admire professional musicians a great deal, but feel that music is far too important to leave it all up to them.musicians and singers.
results.name: Baltimore Classical Musicians Meetup Group

results.description:
Welcome to Scenario Paintball!

We are a band of local woodsball players that have pulled together for the sole purpose of organizing and promoting “objective based, timed woodsball events” in the metro DC & surrounding areas. Our members come from various backgrounds and have played – Renegade, outlaw, speedball, neighborhood pickup games, regional and/national scenario events throughout the world. We now want to have the same fun, energy, and excitement cultivated on to the local circuit. Come join our growing ranks of woodsball players and enjoy the safe friendly, family environment that is best described by our wit and sense of humor – “We have paint with your name on and you’ve got names with our paint on.”

Ready, in 3 seconds, 1…2…Go! Go! Go!

Sincerely,

 

Scenario Paintball management.

Thank you and we look forward to seeing you at a field near you shortly!
results.name: Scenario Paintball - Washington DC

results.description:
We welcome you to join our support group, where you will find comfort and direction in a confidential and supportive setting, and can make a positive difference in the lives of others. There is no charge to join or attend our meetings, but we do recommend your register an account on www.meetup.com. (Note: Our group is actually much larger than what you'll see represented on this website. About 20 people usually show up to each meeting, most of whom are not even Meetup members.) To learn more about our support group and what to expect at our meetings, please click here.

Our support group meets every Tuesday (unless there's a holiday or inclement weather). In addition to our regular meetings, we occasionally participate in a variety of special events throughout the year. You can check out our calendar, or join this Meetup to receive an email reminder before each meeting or event.

We also invite you to make use of all the resources you will find on this site, especially the helpful links and online privacy tips featured on our Pages, as well as our Message Board, where you can join in (or start) an online discussion with other members. Please remember: this is all here for you!


Donations are welcome. Please contact the Group Facilitator(s) for information about making a donation or becoming a regular sponsor.

results.description:
Welcome to Smooth Rhythm Dance Academy! If you're interested in contemporary Hand Dance, you’ve come to the right place. We offer professional and innovative Hand Dance & Bop instruction and coaching, by certified instructors, for beginner through advanced dancers, along with workshops and demonstrations for your favorite social or fraternal event. We are an affiliate of the National Hand Dance Association, and of the Smooth & EZ Hand Dance Institute.

Smooth Rhythm Dance is here to assist you in reaching your Hand Dance 'needs and desires.' Our goals are to provide professional Hand Dance & Bop instruction and coaching for your individual skill level and desires. We strive to take your dance experience to a higher level and help you reach your goals in a more efficient and intensive manner while focusing on individual skills and abilities. We understand that one teaching style may be inadequate for all students; some learn better with more detail, some are more visual; some require a more hands-on approach, and some may be fast learners.

To better accomplish our goals, and to give you the most professional and rewarding learning experience, our focus and emphasis is on Private instruction for our Hand Dance and Bop lessons. Although we had much success with our group classes from 2005 thru 2013, we believe this change is in the best interest of our students.

If you're interested in Private instruction, please contact us at your convenience, by phone, text, or email, to find out how Smooth Rhythm Dance Academy can help you and your dance. We are flexible with scheduling and are anxious to work with you.

For those of you interested in taking Beginner or Intermediate group classes, here is just a small sampling of contemporary Hand Dance schools that provide beginner and intermediate group classes:

Smooth & EZ
Mount Rainer, MD
(202) 722-4610 [Lawrence Bradford]

II Dance!
Morningside, MD
(301) 653-8768 [Kermit Banks]

Simply Swing Dance Academy
Northwest Washington ,DC & Silver Spring, MD
(202) 545-8740 [Kevin Murray]

One Step At A Tyme
Temple Hills, MD
(301) 442-5252 [Dennis Higginbotham]

Dance4Fun
Washington, DC
(301) 559-3178 [Tippi Mavritte]

Silky Smooth Dance Studio
Woodbridge, VA
(703) 217-8992 [Sandra Mason]

While you're here on our site, check out our 'About' page and its 'Table of Contents.' We've included a number of relevant dance articles in which you may find some interest, including a list of Hand Dance venues, a graphical description of the Basic Steps, a sampling of video clips, and more .....

And on our primary web site, SmoothRhythm.com, you may freely browse the largest collection of instructional contemporary Hand Dance videos you'll find anywhere!

Until we meet, 'Dance with Rhythm.....Dance with Style!.'

(P.S.:  Please check out the video sampling below of our Smooth Rhythm Dance classes ....)
results.name: Smooth Rhythm Dance

This meetup will provide opportunities for people from  The Netherlands and/or Flemish Belgium  or for those with an interest in these countries to meet others with similar interests and practice the Dutch Language.

We can do this by meeting in restaurants,  festivals,  members homes or other locations. Suggestions from members are requested and absolutely encouraged.

In order to get to know your fellow members and recognize them at events you need to post a full profile, including a recognizable picture. To keep an active meetup I would also suggest that members attend at least one activity per year.

At the discretion of the organizer, members that do not visit the site or are not active in other ways in this meetup for more than 18 months  or do not have a full profie posted could be removed from the site.

Last but not least,  to keep the website going and  to cover the web hosting fees that meetup charges the organizers, a donation of $5 per year  or $1- $2 per event is kindly requested.

 

Thank you and I hope to see you at one of our events.

 

Monique S.

Your Host for the Dutch Language Meetup

Topics are based on the current interests of members and may include seasonal holidays, reiki, tarot and palm reading, spell work, magickal crafting, or simply the congenial company of like-minded people.

Monthly events are hosted at private homes generously opened to the group by various members. These events are potluck-style, and shared snacks (no matter how small) are appreciated.

results.description:
This Meetup presents workshops and classes that provide experience and instruction in fashion/glamour photography. The purpose is to give members hands on experience working with models in a photo studio and also provide classroom instruction. Discussion topics include camera settings, studio lighting, interacting with the model, use of wardrobe and makeup, the photographer's role in managing a photo shoot, and using Photoshop and other software to create high quality images.

Workshop attendees will enhance their understanding of studio lighting, be able to practice with a model in a live setting, and will learn about pre and post production processes.

The Meetup is open to all levels of photographers who want to enhance their knowledge and experience in fashion/glamour photography.

Each hands on workshop can accommodate up to six (6) photographers. Classes can accommodate up to ten (10) individuals.

Workshop coordinator Phil Kogan is a skilled studio fashion/glamour photographer. He wants to share his knowledge and understanding of fashion/glamour photography and help others enjoy this exciting field.
results.name: Washington Fashion/Glamour Photography Workshops

results.description:
Fun walks and you walk at your own pace. 5k (1 hour) 10k (2 hours) ask at start table if you want to walk with another walker. Come and have fun.  Below is the long story of our sport "volkswalking or volksmarching"  Just a fun walk that kept the German name.  Come out and have fun!!!   Please pay the walk fee of $3 to keep this site going.

The Freestate Happy Wanderers and the Maryland Volkssport Association sponsors and pays for this site.  My Freestate club is an active volksmarch club in Maryland and we sponsor non-competitive walking events (volksmarches) throughout the year. For information on all walks in Maryland and the metro area checkout www.mdvolks.org/freestate/ or go to our national website www.ava.org to find walks all over the USA.  At the ava.org site find Walking Events, then click on Maryland or state you are looking for a walk.

Just a note to remind everyone that we post these walks for everyone to decide if they would like to attend.  We are unable to attend all of the walks but other walkers at the volksmarches will be happy to explain our sport or wait at the sign-in table and someone would be glad to walk with you.  We are always at the Freestate events so look for Bill or Linda.  Thanks.

The walks listed on the meet-up group are walks we will have members from Freestate attending. At each event we have a short trail that you can walk in about one (1) hour and we have a longer trail you can walk in about two (2) hours. OUR CLUB IS A MEMBER OF THE AMERICAN VOLKSSPORT ASSOCIATION (AVA), A NATIONAL, NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT PROMOTES AN AWARENESS OF PHYSICAL FITNESS FOR PEOPLE OF ALL AGES. THE AVA IS AN AFFILIATE OF THE INTERNATIONAL VOLKSSPORT ASSOCIATION (IVV). FREESTATE IS ALSO A MEMBER OF THE MARYLAND VOLKSSPORT ASSOCIATION EVENTS - OUR WALKING EVENTS, USUALLY SCHEDULED ON WEEKENDS, ARE NOT CONTESTS OF SPEED OR ENDURANCE. THEY ARE NOT PLEDGE WALKS. THEY ARE FUN WALKS TO DO BY YOURSELF, OR WITH YOUR FAMILY OR FRIENDS, AT YOUR OWN PACE. ADEQUATE TIME IS ALLOWED TO FINISH THE EVENT. YOU CAN FIND OUT ABOUT EVENTS IN LOCAL NEWSPAPERS, ON THE INTERNET, OR BY ATTENDING SCHEDULED EVENTS AND PICKING UP BROCHURES ABOUT UPCOMING WALKS. EVENTS ARE LISTED ON THE INTERNET WWW.AVA.ORG. Leisure Walking and Hiking FREESTATE HAS A CLUB NEWSLETTER AND SPONSORS SEVERAL SOCIAL FUNCTIONS DURING THE YEAR and GROUP WALKS. PLEASE SEND US A EMAIL at wahasse1798@verizon.net for EXPLANATION OF VOLKSSPORTING AND A CALENDAR OF EVENTS, VISIT THE AVA WEBSITE: WWW.AVA.ORG. OR FREESTATE’S AT www.mdvolks.org/freestate/.

WHY DO WE WALK?
FOR FITNESS, FUN AND FRIENDSHIP. OUR EVENTS GIVE PARTICIPANTS AN OPPORTUNITY TO SEE THINGS THEY MIGHT MISS IF THEY DROVE, RATHER THAN WALKED, THROUGH AN AREA. OUR WALKING EVENTS ARE MANY THINGS, BUT ABOVE ALL THEY ARE JOINING WITH OTHER PEOPLE – ON A TRAIL, THROUGH A PARK OR HISTORICAL AREAS, OR RIGHT IN YOUR OWN NEIGHBORHOOD --- FOR EXERCISE AND ENJOYMENT.

WHAT’S THE POINT?
OUR GOAL IS TO PROMOTE PHYSICAL FITNESS AND GOOD HEALTH BY ENCOURAGING EVERYONE TO PARTICIPATE. OUR ACTIVITIES ARE GEARED TOWARD PROVIDING WHOLESOME RECREATION AND EXERCISE FOR CHILDREN AND ADULTS, AS INDIVIDUALS, GROUPS, AND FAMILIES.

DO I HAVE TO WALK FAST?
WALK AT YOUR OWN PACE: GO AS FAST OR AS SLOW AS YOU WANT. RUN OR POWER WALK IF YOU WANT TO BE MORE AEROBIC. STROLL IF YOU WISH. STOP TO PICNIC, SHOP, OR SIGHTSEE IF YOU WANT. SOME PEOPLE WALK WITH THEIR DOGS. JOGGERS ALSO WELCOME.

HOW FAR DO I HAVE TO WALK? HOW LONG DOES IT TAKE?
MOST WALKS ARE 6.2 MILES (10-KM). A SHORTER OPTION OF 3.1 MILES (5-KM) AT A MODERATE PACE, IT TAKES MOST PEOPLE TWO HOURS TO WALK 10-KM AND ONE HOUR TO WALK A 5-KM TRAIL. MORE DIFFICULT TRAILS TAKE LONGER.
DO WE WALK IN THE RAIN?
EVENTS ARE HELD RAIN OR SHINE, SO WALKERS ARE ENCOURAGED TO COME PREPARED FOR ANY KIND OF REASONABLE WEATHER.
WHAT DOES IT COST?
EACH WALK IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC. EACH WALKER IS CHARGED A MODEST FEE FOR PARTICIPATION AT OUR EVENTS. THE FEE INCLUDES PARTICIPATION IN THE INTERNATIONAL ACHIEVEMENT AWARDS PROGRAM, WHICH RECOGNIZES ATTAINMENT OF SPECIFIED LEVELS OF CUMULATIVE EVENT AND DISTANCE TOTALS. A COMMEMORATIVE EVENT AWARD IS SOMETIMES AVAILABLE. IT COSTS A FEW DOLLARS MORE TO PURCHASE.
COMPLETE THE DISTANCE AND REDEEM OFFICIAL RECORD BOOKS AT ESTABLISHED MILESTONES FOR AN ATTRACTIVE CERTIFICATE, PATCH, AND HATPIN TO RECOGNIZE YOUR ACHIEVEMENT. EVERYONE IS A WINNER!
EVENT RECORD BOOKS
STAMPED ONCE FOR EACH EVENT NO MATTER WHICH DISTANCE WALKED OR HOW MANY TIMES YOU COMPLETE THE TRAIL. REDEEM AT MILESTONES: 10 EVENTS, 30 EVENTS, 50 EVENTS, ETC.
AT EACH EVENT, BY PAYING THE MODEST CREDIT FEE OF $3 YOU GET BOTH BOOKS STAMPED AND PROVIDE FUNDS TO CONTINUE OUR WALKING SPORT.
results.name: Maryland Walkers

results.description:
WHAT: This is primarily a SOCIAL VOLLEYBALL GROUP. We ideally play to have fun, be outside, get some exercise, and meet new people. We are not a "league". Players of various skill levels will pay on a court together, primarily in a 6v6 format, but may vary depending on the number of players in attendance. That said, "beginner players" (those with NO skills or who demonstrate an inability to play at even a basic level (i.e. don't or can't pass a ball) should likely consider other options, as such players greatly disrupt play.

Membership is $60/season and all funds are used to obtain permitted access to Howard County Park & Recreation facilities. We have a discounted arrangement with HoCo P&R to purchase and donate volleyball court-related equipment in exchange for permit access. New members have a 30-day trial period after which dues must be paid in order to continue to attend events.

Note: If you are a player with a higher skill level (B/BB, etc.) and are looking for more consistent, more competitive games, please visit THIS PAGE or contact Devon for information on leagues, tournaments, etc. in the area. DO NOT EXPECT TO COME TO THE MEETUP AND PLAY AT ANY SPECIFIC LEVEL (though having fun is a good expectation!)

WHERE: We will be playing at Savage Park in Maryland for the 2015 season. Savage Park is located at 8400 Fair St., Savage, MD 20763. If necessary, we may play at additional HoCo venues, including Cedar Lane Park West and Centennial Park.

INCLEMENT WEATHER: If it rains or the weather is bad please check the Meetup page for that day - an organizer will usually post if cancelled.


Frequently Asked Questions
I've never played volleyball before/haven't played organized volleyball. Will anyone teach me/help me?

    No training is available/there are no instructors for those with no/limited skills - but other members tend to be helpful and offer tips on how to play. If there's enough interest "newbie" Meetups may be considered (contact an organizer if interested). Again - absolute "beginner players" will likely not find this group to be a good "fit".

How many players can play at the same time?

    With 2 courts, the max number of players able to play simultaneously are 24 (6v6). When more than 24 are present, we rotate additional players in on the service and the front hitting line (for an additional 2 players per side). In cases when there are greater than 32 players, teams of 6 may be formed and play will consist of either "king of the court" (winning team stays on until they lose) or "2 games on, 1 game off" (every team will play 2 games in a row, and then sit for at least 1 game). If we regularly have greater numbers of players attending, we will add additional events simultaneously at other venues.
results.name: Columbia - Volleyball

results.description:
Kent Island has great biking trails/paths and many wide shouldered roads We need to take advantage of these resources and explore some of the natural beauty and history of the Island. The purpose of the group is to do just that, while getting exercise in a social setting that will allow all to enjoy the fun of biking or triking. We offer local rides just for our group as well as rides that are organized by other biking clubs, where we organize a day trip or even travel over a weekend to see other parts of Maryland or the mid-Atlantic. Hopefully something on our calendar will work for you. We also encourage members to suggest rides they think would interest the Klub. Come as little or as often as you like. So anyone interested in group rides on Kent Island, surrounding Queen Anne's County, Baltimore County, a ride across the Bay or an occasional day or weekend excursion to an organized cycling event should join this group. Happy trails and keep on pedaling.

Helmets are required on all rides. Ride at your own risk.
results.name: Kent Island Cycling Klub (KICK)

results.description:
Join others to learn & share ideas in an open forum run by one of the most successful meetup organizers in the area. This is the first meetup group designed to assist people & businesses with all aspects of online & offline monetization.

The focus is on finding out what is working, and how to either start or grow revenue & conversions for a website, blog, app, game, or newsletter. (Monetization in this case referring to revenue/sales/income/donation).

Designed to let online entrepreneuers, bloggers, site owners, store owners, businesses, marketers, home-based and others network, learn & share strategies for creating & growing revenue streams. Especially in the online world, there are new techniques developed every day, and we'll create a forum to share & experiment on old & new methods.

* Strategy & Tactics

* Do's & Don'ts

* Marketing & monetizing effectiveness

* Defining Monetization - understanding Business Models

* Categorizing online revenue sources

* Analysis of Emerging Online Models (e.g. Twitter, iPhone/apps, Virtual products)

** "Freemium"

** Game monetization & virtual worlds

** Social apps

* Offsite Monetization (including email)

* Showcase Sites - Learn From Others

* Practice Sessions

* Website Design Analysis (Heat Maps, navigation/usability)

* Best Platforms - content management, ads, tracking, back-end

results.description:
The Westfield Neighborhood Improvement Association is dedicated to all aspects of the quality of life in our community: neighborliness, attractiveness, relationships with elected officials, safety, zoning, traffic and more. We are diverse in culture and lifestyle and rich in talent: from artists to engineers; police and firemen to teachers — and supportive of our resident owners of businesses like electrical and construction contractors, landscape architects, graphic designers, restaurants and many more. We are singles and families of all age groups — with a new-resident trend of mid 20's through mid 40's.

Westfield is home to architectural styles from brick and stone Colonials to Bungalows and Cape Cods. Here are shady front porches with arched doors and stained glass windows casting colors onto hardwood floors. We have backyards and driveways you won’t find downtown! Some homes have been lovingly cared for through the years — and some newly-renovated with vision.

We welcome new residents! Click here to learn more About Our Neighborhood, including a list of Features & Benefits! http://www.meetup.com/WestfieldAssociation/about/

results.description:
Welcome Skiers and Boarders. The Baltimore Ski Club is over 60 years old and offers an opportunity for both Skiers and Boarders to meet for social activities and play in the snow together. BSC supports Many trips a year to Eastern, Western and European destinations. In addition to savings and friendships made by traveling in a group, BSC offers partial refunds for lessons and Nastar races when a member travels on one of our sponsored trips. Why not check us out and see what we offer and what fun it can be as a member of the Baltimore areas oldest ski club.

Meetings are held on the first Wednesday of the month September through April at Divinity Lutheran Church on Provident Rd. Doors open at 7pm. Come early, come often, have fun. Also check us out at our website www.baltimoreskiclub.com.

results.description:
This group is for Dachshund owners and their short little companions. We meet every third Sunday of the month. In warm weather we meet at 5:00pm and in cooler weather we meet at 3:00pm. If it's raining then we don't meet that month. Our Meetup is held in the Agility Yard of the Happy Tails Pet Resort in Crownsville, MD. This is a large fenced in area so the Dachshunds can run free without worry. Water and poop bags will be supplied but feel free to bring whatever you need for your Doxie. We are an informal open group, but there are a couple of rules as follows:

1. All friendly, well behaved Dachshunds are welcome. The dogs owner is responsible to watch their own dog(s) behavior.

2. Please park along the fence for the Agility Yard and if walking your dog outside of the fenced-in area, please do not wander onto the private property of Happy Tails Pet Resort.

3. Clean up your pup's poop. Bags will be supplied, and please remember we are guests here.

4. Make sure all your pets shots are up to date. Also if your Doxie is sick leave them at home to heal.

5. And last but not least, HAVE FUN and welcome to the Dippy Dachshund Group!!!!!!
results.name: The Crownsville Dippy Dachshund Group

results.description: Meet people in your own back yard and from around the world who love to travel and who have an appreciation for great music and love to dance. Novices who would like to learn to dance or enjoy watching great dance moves will also have fun with this group. We will provide occasions to participate in a lot of fun events with family, friends and new acquaintances plus unique opportunities to find that perfect travel buddy or dance partner. Join us for our first Meet-Up, February 14, 2010, as we cruise 7-days on the Carnival Pride to the Bahamas with a stop over in Port Canaveral Florida on the way. This cruise event will feature dance workshops by One Step at a Tyme Dance Institute instructors, along with dance parties, dance competitions, a private farewell cocktail party and much, much more. There will be something for everyone that likes to dance, cruise, and meet other dancers with common interests. Singles are welcome; we can assist in providing options for singles roommates and there will be plenty of partners. Couples are welcome too. We offer something for everybody that loves to dance and cruise! There will be plenty of opportunity to dance, mingle, enjoy the beautiful ship, relax and go on shore excursions. So pack your dancing shoes and get ready for a week long JAM as we travel to the laid back, relaxing, sun-drenched, paradise known as the Bahamas!

results.description:
African Diaspora Roots and Culture

This is friendly and diverse group that connects all people through the celebration and exploration of the culture and history of the Black African Diaspora.

"A people without knowledge of its past is like a tree without a root." Marcus Garvey

Diaspora (DI-'AS-PAR-A) n

a. The breakup and scattering of people.

b. People scattered far from their ancestral

homelands.

c. The place where these people live .

Our Faces in Diverse Places

Join ADRC members on trips to a variety of places through the local area exploring other cultures and activities. Enjoy learning experiences in environments which promote bi-directional learning and thinking.

Historic Travels

Join ADRC to historic places that have been influenced by black African decedents. Explore and learn how these places have contributed to society.

Around Town

Join ADRC as we travel locally in Maryland , Washington, DC and Virgina to visit places and participate in activities around town.

What’chu Talkin’ ‘Bout ADRC?

Join ADRC as we hear various letctures and discussion on topics ranging from health to finance. Join us to watch films that seek to entertain and educate. Expand your mind and broaden your horizons.

Group Trips

Join ADRC for its Annual group trip or  smaller quarterly trip

Socialize

Join us as we let our hair down or up!

Our local meetups cover Maryland, Northern Viginia and Washington, DC

Join us on facebook. www.facebook.com/culchaseeker
results.name: African Diaspora Roots and Culture (ADRC)

results.description: All of us share an interest in sacred chant known as "kirtan," a devotional practice of singing, drumming, and participating in group energy for the purpose of elevating the spirit, building community, and realizing interconnectedness. The practice originated in India millennia ago, but has been popularized in the West by singers such as Krishna Das, Jai Uttal, Wah!, Dave Stringer, Deva Premal, Bhagavan Das, David Newman (Durga Das), etc. This list will be a place to share information about local kirtan events and other sacred/vibrational singing, music, and/or drumming in the Metro DC area.

results.description:
This group is for the down-to-earth, fun loving person who enjoys movies of all kinds - from the suspenseful thriller to the fast paced action flick to the 'laugh til you cry' comedy and everything in between. We are a laid back group with no drama...not unless its on the 'big screen'...LOL! We will regularly check out new releases at surrounding Baltimore area theaters and relax afterwards at a nearby spot for good food, hearty dialogue and fun times. Depending on the movie, the discussion topics are bound to be endless. Movie times will vary from a movie and light dinner or a matinee and a late lunch.

And because we are so much more than just movie lovers, we will get out and enjoy other interests, too - cultural events, festivals, comedy clubs, live music or maybe a play at a local theater.  The sky is the limit!  So, if you are up for some fun, have an open mind for stimulating conversation with positive people, then this is the "crew" for you. Good friendships are bound to happen while sharing what we love - MOVIES....& More, too!

Peace~

P.S.  Although members are not obligated to attend every event, we do want members who are active, open to making new friends and willing to share mutual interests.  With that said, all you need to do is check out the calendar regularly, RSVP for events that grab your interest and fit your schedule and join us for some fun.  (Wall flowers who are inactive after ninety days or have excessive no-shows will be removed from the group to make room for free spirits.)  :-))

We look forward to meeting you soon!

results.description:
Meet diverse people of all ages in your own back yard and from around the world who love to travel.  Go to places you only dreamed of, or thought you couldn't afford.

This is a serious travel group for travel enthusiasts.  However, the seasoned traveler, occasional traveler and even newbies are all welcome!

Mark Twain once remarked, in a critique of American isolationism, that “broad, wholesome, charitable views of... (people) and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one’s lifetime.”   

Through our travels, we hope to challenge and change you, opening up new ways for you to see and be in the world.  You will return home a "global citizen" seeing the world through "new eyes".  

In each trip we plan, there will be an opportunity to have a cultural exchange with the local people and when possible an opportunity to "give back" while creating lasting memories and connections to the locale and/or the people.

We will also provide occasions to participate in a lot of fun, adventurous or relaxing travel trips.  So grab your family and friends or meet new acquaintances and take advantage of the opportunity to find that perfect travel buddy.

results.description:
The Graphic Novel Bookgroup reads in as wide a range as there are literary genres. The one commonality is that they all involve stories told with the aid of pictures - sequential storytelling. Obviously, this definition does not limit the content, and, if you were to browse several graphic novels, you’d find striking variety: memoir, journalism, literary fiction, humor, experimental, abstract, underground comix, sketchbook/journaling, superhero, mainstream, manga, manwha, the list goes on. Like any form of art, graphic novels often push the limits in terms of content and methodology—engaging the reader/viewer in the act of creating and communicating the story.

From the popular and lauded to the obscure, we try to read and discuss books which offer enough of a substantial story to encourage discussion, disagreement, and criticism. We focus as much on the story (narrative and dialogue) as we do on the art (drawing style and layout of the frames). Our bookstore also is invested in increasing discussion of and interest in graphic novels, from panels with artists to participating in the Small Press eXpo (SPX) every year. The group is composed of young and old, male and female, those who’ve spent their lives immersed in the genre and others who’ve only read a few. Excellent graphic works are becoming increasingly available—thanks to a growing readership and reviewers who are willing to praise this expanding field—so come and join us, and read our recommendations at politics-prose.com/graphic-novels.
results.name: Politics and Prose Graphic Novel Bookgroup

results.description:
We are a community action group to support the Maryland Human Trafficking Task Force (MHTTF) Victims & Public Services Committee. We seek to combat modern slavery, which is the exploitation of individuals through the use of force, fraud, or coercion, for the purpose of sexual exploitation or forced labor. The purpose of the group is to provide a forum for the community to participate in the fight against human trafficking/trading by supporting the work of the MHTTF.

Come join us and explore how you can take part!

----------------
OUR VISION
----------------
Abolition, not prohibition of slavery in Maryland

-----------------
OUR MISSION
-----------------
To support the work of Maryland Human Trafficking Task Force by…
- Creating a forum for education, engagement, and action;
- Foster grassroots movements for local change in our own community
- Complement existing efforts of NGO’s, government, private sector, and the community

-----------------
OUR ACTIONS
-----------------
- Raising awareness
- Conducting grassroots campaigns
- Sponsoring and coordinating events
- Advocating effective anti-slavery related policy
- Empowering and guiding other groups
- Inspiring others to take action

-----------------
MD SMS DOES NOT
-----------------
- Endorse a specific anti-trafficking organization (NGOs)
- Organize fund raising events for specific organization
- Run an independent program to help the victim or enforce the law

-----------------
FOR MORE INFO
-----------------
- Follow us on Twitter at @MDSMS
- Blog: http://mdhttf.blogspot.com/
- Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/home.php?#/gr......
results.name: Maryland Stop Modern-day Slavery

results.description:
WELCOME to Club Crabtowne

IMPORTANT Non Club Crabtowne Meetup Users: (Have not signed up for Club Crabtowne Meetup) 
When an event is 'Deleted' or 'Canceled' it will not appear below. There is no way to contact an individual that might be thinking about appearing for an event. All events not 'Deleted' remain on the Calendar. These events may be viewed by clicking on 'Our Calendar' on the left. 'Deleted' events are removed from the Calendar. 

If you have RSVP'd for an event that is 'Deleted' or "Canceled', you can receive statuses through Email Update, Mobile Notification, or Social Media based on your choices.


Suggest and Host an Event

Please suggest events (should be a Crabtowne Meetup member).

Event hosts must be a 'paying' Crabtowne member: Membership Application

Please pass along your event idea(s) to:

    Club Crabtowne Meetup organizers at: Club Crabtowne Meetup

    Or email event idea(s) to: Crabtowne Charlie

Membership

Membership is from July though June, cost is $30 single and $45 family, and additional if you would like the newsletter (snail) mailed. Complete the Membership Application, and mail it in today to join the fun!

Club Crabtowne members enjoy these benefits:

    Great way to meet people involved in events that you enjoy. These events include: various social activities, biking, dancing, hiking, sailing and watersports.

    Entertaining and informative speakers at our monthly gerneral meeting.

    Discounts on various Club Crabtowne events such as skiing, watersports, etc.

    Discounts are offered by various area businesses with a Club Crabtowne membership card.

    Monthly Chronicle (Newsletter) is published, and e-mailed or snail mailed.

    Annual Club Crabtowne Directory is provided with a membership card.

    Voting privilege at our elections.

Who We Are

Club Crabtowne is the premier Annapolis ski, sports, and events club, that has been organizing exciting events for our members for over forty years. Founded in 1971 as the "Annapolis Ski Club", we have also been known as the "Crabtowne Ski Club™" and the "Crabtowne Skiers™".

What We Do
Crabtowne year-round events span a wide range of interests. We are 'not just a ski club' we organize a variety of interesting events. Crabtowne has a long history of doing pretty much anything our members think will be fun: past events have included the areas listed above as well as golf, tennis, volleyball, touring as a group in various parts of the world, white water rafting, canoeing, hang gliding, flying sailplanes, hot air ballooning, and attending barnstorming air shows. If you think there is something fun (and reasonably legal) that the club could do, talk to a Board member or a committee chairperson to get the ball rolling. Bring us your ideas... let's start new traditions or reinvigorate old ones.

Affiliations
Blue Ridge Ski Council (BRSC) affiliate - The Blue Ridge Ski Council sanctions certain ski trips (and some non-ski trips) that member clubs open to other club's members. Crabtowne members may participate in sanctioned ski trips run by other BRSC-affiliated ski clubs, without paying their additional non-membership fees.
results.name: Club Crabtowne

results.description: This group is dedicated to organizing gaming sessions, running the gamut from Eurogames to Wargames, with party games not unwelcome. Eurogames "are a broad class of tabletop games that generally have simple rules, short to medium playing times, high levels of player interaction, and attractive physical components. The games emphasise strategy, downplay luck and conflict, lean towards economic rather than military themes, and usually keep all the players in the game until it ends... Their rulebooks are typically four to twelve pages long and playing times are on the order of 30 to 120 minutes. These games appeal to a wide range of ages, though generally not very young children. The audience includes casual gamers, who play with family and friends, as well as more serious hobby gamers" (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German-style_board_game). Adults only please. Parents are welcome to bring children if the kids won't disturb the festivities. We're happy to teach folks how to play a new game so don't fret if you haven't played one of these games before. Come on by for a fun time and to meet new folks!
results.name: Riverdale Gaming Conclave (by College Park)

results.description:
Happiness is a state of mind or feeling characterized by contentment, satisfaction, pleasure, or joy. Happiness comes from deep within, and not from people, situations, or circumstances.

According to Researchers from Harvard Medical School and the University of California, San Diego:

“When an individual becomes happy, the network effect can be measured up to three degrees. One person’s happiness triggers a chain reaction that benefits not only his friends, but his friends’ friends, and his friends’ friends’ friends. The effect lasts for up to one year.”

Since whatever we focus on grows, the aim of this group is to help members focus on happiness and to spread it at every opportunity.

If you are a happy person and want to socialize and network with other happy people, this is for you. If your goal is to become a happier person this group is for you. If you want to contaminate others with your happiness, this group is definitely for you. Visit http://iamhappyproject.org for more information; while you are there please follow us on twitter and like us on Facebook.
results.name: I am Happy Project - Baltimore, MD

results.description: We are a group of people in the DC-MD-VA area who are interested in hypnosis and/or NLP (Neuro-Linguistic Programming). results.description: This Meetup is designed to get its members and friends to dance for fun. No partners are Necessary. We attend dances with great live bands every Friday Night so you can meet up with 200+ people any weekend you choose. The fee for these dances is extremely reasonable ($15), considering the fee covers a beginning lesson, dancing to a band, and light refreshments. Wow, a great bargain! There are over 25 different bands who love to play for dancers. You will be able to dance all social partner dances. Yes, that includes all styles of Swing, Ballroom and Latin dances. What, you don't know how to do these dances fear not you can take lessons very reasonable priced lessons ($10/hour) with super instructors Monday thru Friday. BTW the dancers on Fridays are also very willing to help you get started! Our "Mission" is to get ALL people young and old, to Join our Social, Swing, and Ballroom partner dancing group. No, you don't have to be a PRO, or young and hip, or "Sweet"( translation "Cool") to enjoy partner Dancing. No Partners are necessary to take part in our dances or lessons. This group believes, once you learn the basics of dance, you can experience the joy of dancing and ALL people can learn to dance, and dance together for years. Partner dancing is the best way to meet and keep friends for life! Group's dances and lessons are for ALL! Singles, Couples, ALL ages 16 and - UP! (Yes, dances and lessons include YOU, the Beginner, the Young and Hip, and even the "Stars") Get out and dance, Your heart will love you!

results.description:

results.description: The mission of the Maryland Native Plant Society (http://www.mdflora.org/) is to promote awareness, appreciation, and conservation of Maryland's native plants and their habitats. We pursue our mission through education, research, advocacy, and service activities. This Meetup is used for posting plant walks, monthly programs, and other events. The purpose of our walks is to identify plants. So we tend to stop frequently, looking closely at plants and not walking very far. No botany expertise is required. Walks are generally led by someone who has at least basic experience identifying plants and many are led by botanists with many years of field experience. Our monthly meetings are usually held at Kensington Library in Silver Spring on the last Tuesday of each month and feature a presentation on a topic related to native plants. We're on facebook at: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Maryland-Native-Plant-Society/232641092294?ref=ts
results.name: Maryland Native Plant Society Meetup

results.description:
Interested in learning a foreign language? Wondering where you can find Spanish classes? Need someone to practice French with? Want to learn more about Arabic? Or are you just someone you speaks multiple languages who wants to meet other language enthusiasts?

Come join us to learn about foreign languages - any language! This group is for people who want to learn, are learning, or teaching a foreign language and want to meet others who are doing the same. We do not limit our group to any one language - but rather all of them! And for people of all levels are welcome too - from beginners to native speakers and polyglots.

We will host various events focusing languages from different regions in the world, such as happy hours, language discussions, cultural events, and foreign film screening. Each event will have a theme focusing on a different language and region of the world.

Join us and find out why languages are for lovers!
results.name: DC Language Lovers

results.description:
Founded to provide an affirming environment for individuals who are committed to an inter-spiritual approach to spirituality, encompassing all faiths and all traditions, and who wish to express their spirituality in a universal tradition without dogma.

PLEASE  DO NOT JOIN THE MEETUP GROUP IF YOU DO NOT PLAN ON ATTENDING EVENTS.

We are an independent community of the Order of Univeral Interfath (OUnI.org), and founded by Rev. Ed Geraty.  We meet weekly for discussion and exploration of Consciousness, Awareness, or Enlightenment.  We are an awakening community, meaning that we are aware that we are more than our personal Ego-self.

Some of our meetings focus on Non Dual spirituality. We have a monthly movie night with movies based on Consciousness exploration. We also hold Kirtans (Bhakti Yoga) and weekly  Insight Meditation sittings.  Join us.

We are located within The Insight Center, 2 Oakway Road, Timonium, MD 21093

https://www.facebook.com/BaltimoreInsightCenter

Namaste

Rev. Ed Geraty

results.description:
I started this group because I want to keep up on the latest books on global affairs, international development, foreign policy, economics, or finance.  I also wanted to meet other people out there with the same interests who crave stimulating intellectual discussions.  I thought this group could serve as a way to motivate us to stay current on the latest literature and lead us into some fun discussions.

You should join this group if you are one of the many Washington area professionals (like me) who work in the international arena (US govt, World Bank, IMF, NGO, foreign embassy) or just someone with a passion for international affairs who wants to learn more and interact with like-minded people.  I miss the interesting discussions I used to have in grad school (SAIS) with people from all over the world, and I'd like to bring some of that back.

Some of the books I'm interested in are:  Common Wealth by Jeffrey Sachs, The Bottom Billion by Paul Collier, the Post-American World by Fareed Zakarias, and Hot Flat and Crowded by Thomas Friedman.  These are just a few ideas and I am open to other suggestions.  Feel free to send me a message or post to the message board if you have any suggestions.

I imagine meeting up about once a month at a convenient location.  Once we have enough members, we can vote on which book to read first.  Non-Americans are very welcome.  Let the intellectual stimulation begin!
results.name: DC International Affairs Book Club

results.description:
The Life Dance Loft is a space that offers...

Biodanza
 QiGong
Life Coaching for teens and adults
Meditation
Drumming
and so much more....

It's a wellness space for the community.  Come join us at a class or workshop.

 

THE BIODANZA CLASS/WORKSHOP....

Biodanza is a system of human development that fuses music, movement, and emotions building a sense of community for those who practice it regularly. This unique combination of elements expands our creativity, vitality and our ability to love. Biodanza is about feeling the fullness of every moment and awakening our passion for life. It is about loving life and putting life in the center.

With carefully selected music that evokes specific experiences and invites movement, the participants will discover JOY and happiness within themselves. With Biodanza movement becomes a free expression of self, and is not choreographed or structured. No previous dance experience is required and there are no age requirements. Biodanza is for everyone! The magic of Biodanza will open your sense of joy, self-esteem and self-confidence. Come dance with life!

Biodanza workshops are a way to discover the pleasure to...

•Expand your creativity, vitality and ability to love.

•Feel the fullness of every moment and awake your passion for life.

•Open your sense of joy, self-esteem and self-confidence.

•Tenderly integrate feelings, mind and actions.

•Improve your health and organic harmony.

Come dance with life!

 

www.lifedance.me

results.description:
This group is for Cavalier King Charles Spaniels (or a variation of such :) owners and their royal little companions. We meet every fourth Sunday of the month at 10:00am. If it's raining then we don't meet that month. Our Meetup is held in the Agility Yard of the Happy Tails Pet Resort in Crownsville, MD. This is a large fenced in area so the Spaniels can run free without worry. Water and poop bags will be supplied but feel free to bring whatever you need for your Cavalier. We are an informal open group, but there are a couple of rules as follows:

1. All friendly, well behaved Cavaliers are welcome. The dogs owner is responsible to watch their own dog(s) behavior.

2. Please park along the fence for the Agility Yard and if walking your dog outside of the fenced-in area, please do not wander onto the private property of Happy Tails Pet Resort.

3. Clean up your pup's poop. Bags will be supplied, and please remember we are guests here.

4. Make sure all your pets shots are up to date. Also if your Cavalier is sick leave them at home to heal.

5. And last but not least, HAVE FUN and welcome to The Crownsville Cavaliers Group!!!!!!
results.name: The Crownsville Cavaliers

results.description:
Hi,

The group is for women 45+ (single or married, ranging from 45-75 in age) who love creating beautiful crafts be it knitting (3/4 of us are knitters), needlepoint, quilting, cross-stitch, crocheting, rug hooking,  or other crafts such as altered books/art, beading, collage art, decoupage, etc., and want a way to make new friends and finish projects at the same time. You are invited to come to the founder's home in Kensington/Silver Spring, MD every Sunday  from 2:00-5:00 (coming weekly is NOT mandatory) to get inspired, learn about other crafts and have fun. "I have decided to do this in my home because, like the book club that meets here monthly (9th year) I can keep the meeting size to about 20 people, which is far more condusive to making friends and sharing than a large hall of 200 people". We meet every Sunday from 2:00- 5:00 or later but attending weekly is not mandatory.

Again, coming to every meeting is not mandatory (but hope you do).......this should be fun and not an obligation. I serve hot tea, coffee and sodas with members bringing snacks like biscuits/cookies/scones, cheese and crackers, etc. to share along with good conversation and laughter.  While you work on your own projects, help each other with projects if you're stuck, learn a new skill (like knitting) and join in on beach retreats and weekend trips to workshops, shows, fairs, speciality shops, etc. for those interested.

The Founder is a self employed business woman and artist/crafts person......who loves knitting as well as most of the needlework venues mentioned in first paragraph. She also pursues the arts in general: theater, music (Jazz, Rock, Blues, Opera, etc.), and galleries as well as antiqueing/flea marketing, the beach, reading (personal and Book Club), traveling (including day and weekend adventures), taking art/craft workshops, Indie and "good"movies, Jane Austen, cooking, etc. She and other  women friends regularily do many of these activities together and are always open to new people joining in from the club.

If interested, please write me a bit about yourself: needlework/ craft interests, other interests, what projects do you want to finish, what do you do if you are still working, how old you are, what area you live in, etc. If you appear to be a good fit, I'll ask you to call me so we can talk a bit first to know each other a bit better. I look forward to meeting you,

Polly (Founder)
results.name: Knitting and NeedleCrafts Social/Tea Club- Kensington, MD

results.description:
Are you a girl who is new in town or just ready to make some new friends? Are you looking to build strong, meaningful relationships and make our little corner of the world a better place? 

 

We are a group of girls who are all of the above and so much more. We want to connect with others to befriend, encourage and support one another on life's journey. We are ladies with open minds and open hearts. We are diverse in our backgrounds and beliefs and we respect each others' differences.

 

We are looking for other women who want to have fun and make new friends while enjoying all the opportunities for dining, entertainment, culture and fun available in and around the Columbia area while sharing our time and abilities with local charitable causes to create an enjoyable and balanced life - a life full of social activities as well as volunteer opportunities that will help each of us reach our fullest potential. 

 

Join us at dinners, movies, game nights, discussions, spa days, book club, nights out, shopping, community service opportunities and much more!

 

"Two may talk together under the same roof for many years, yet never really meet; and two others at first speech are old friends."  - Mary Catherwood

results.description:
Wounded Warriors as Healers is a group for women veterans wishing to learn EFT (emotional freedom techniques) to heal their own emotional wounds and help other vets to heal theirs.

Linda Grant DePauw, the group organizer, is Founder and President of The MINERVA Center, Inc. which has provided information and inspiration to military women and women veterans since 1983. She is Professor Emeritus of History at the George Washington University where she pioneered the field of women's military studies and, since her retirement, a life coach, and EFT practitioner.

Group members will have the opportunity to enroll in a six week training to eventually qualify as EFT practitioners. The training uses the original Gary Craig videos and teaching materials. In addition to studying and discussing these materials, participants will experience using EFT techniques in a group setting. At the conclusion of the training a certificate of completion will be issued.

http://www.magicalgodmother.com/EFT
results.name: Wounded Warriors as Healers

If you have or trying to get a Network+, Security+, CCNA, CEH, CISSP, CHFI...etc, lets get together and expand on our knowledge by cooperating in lectures, hands on labs and group discussions about all things network / computer security and forensics related.

Each meeting will strive to involve technical hand-outs, penetration testing labs to try out various security tools and scenarios, updates on the latest trends in computer and network security with occasional lectures by various Security Professionals just to name a few of our meetups.

If you are looking to gain more knowledge in the Cyber World then join the club.

results.description:
See our "Pages" tab above and our message board for some additional information accessible to people who have not yet been admitted to our MAWDC Meetup group here.

IMPORTANT:  See legal liability notice at bottom of this description of the organization. You will be admitted to the MAWDC Meetup group on application after confirming by email response your personal assumption of risks related to participation in this meetup group. The acknowledgement that we will send you before admission also appears at the bottom of this group description.

The Mycological Association of Washington's meetup group (the "MAWDC Meetup group") is a group for people interested in wild mushroom collecting in and around Washington DC. This group is operated by members of the Mycological Association of Washington (“MAW”), a Section 501(c)(3) non-profit organization formed and operated to support public education about mycological interests. See http://www.mawdc.org/.  In addition to wild mushroom collecting (“forays”) MAW (and MAWDC Meetup members) enjoy walking in the woods, cooking wild foods, learning about the science of mycology and related matters, and meeting others with similar interests.

You can join the MAWDC Meetup group without being a member of MAW, but if you find this at all interesting, you would enjoy being a member of MAW too.  For more details of benefits of being a MAW member, see this Page.

This group will include notices and organizing for MAW-sponsored events that are open to persons who are not MAW members -- but some activities will be limited to active MAW members or will charge a fee to non-MAW members for participation.

Participation in the MAWDC Meetup group is subject at all times to the following waiver and release:

Your participation in the Meetup group (the “Group”) sponsored by the Mycological Association of Washington (“MAW”) constitutes a continuing acknowledgment that you are aware that (a) the identification of wild mushrooms always carries with it the risk that a mushroom may be misidentified, (b) consuming a mushroom that has been incorrectly identified creates a risk of personal injury, including serious illness (up to and including an untimely death), and (c) eating mushrooms and other foraged foods, even if correctly identified, involves a risk of illness, injury or death as a result of personal sensitivity (including allergy or harmful interaction with other medicines you may be taking). In consideration for your acceptance as a member of the Group and/or participation in any activities sponsored by MAW or the Group and their respective members, you agree to, and do, personally assume all risks arising from these activities and agree to release, hold harmless, and indemnify the Group, MAW and any of their officers and members from any and all legal responsibility for injuries or accidents suffered by you, your family members or any minor child under your care during or as a result of any activity conducted or facilitated by the Group or MAW, including but not limited to use of information provided by the Group and MAW directly or in their sponsored websites, and all activities involving mushroom collection, identification or consumption.
results.name: MAWDC Meetup - Mycological Association of Washington DC

results.description:
20s and 30s Hiking Around Maryland offers local hikes that meet on the weekends. These hikes are generally from 2-12 miles and easy to hard.  There are some hikes that will be moderate-difficult to difficult, so please check the skill level of a hike before you RSVP.

Video of our hikes: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqRbNG2o0lBVCEY_wIE0bUg

Given the fact that many of our hikes now have waiting lists, we've started a new NO-SHOW policy.  If you RSVP for a hike with a waiting-list, but do not show-up, you will be moved to the waiting list for the next hike you join.

I'd prefer the hikes to start on time. If you are going to be late please contact the group leader, we will wait 10 minutes for you if you let us know you are on the way.

Dogs are welcome on the hikes where they are allowed. If you plan to bring your dog on a hike, please add a comment when you RSVP.

Members are encouraged to have social events for the group as well. If you have a location or event you would like to suggest for members please contact the organizer or post to the message board.

This group belongs to all the members. If you choose to organize a hike please, if necessary, state the competence level of the participants. If you RSVP to a hike please try to let the organizer know if your plans change.

Additional Assistant organizers and hike leaders are welcome and encouraged. If you are interested in planning hikes please contact the organizer to be allowed access to the calendar. You can set the parameters of the hike be it urban hike, more rigorous hikes, or weekday hikes. This group has enough members to meet the needs of everyone if those belonging are willing to take ownership of the activities.
results.name: 20s and 30s Hiking Around Maryland
