results.description:
GOSU Institute of Chinese Martial Arts is a program aiming to provide people with the highest level of Martial Arts for a low price. We teach Modern Wushu, Traditional Kung Fu, and Chinese Style Kickboxing.  One day we will have a Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) program too.

Anyone is welcome whether you'd like to practice for fitness, self-defense, competition, or for mastery.  Our classes to improve your fitness, flexibility, athleticism, and Martial Arts foundation.  Lessons learned in this class can be applied to other Martial Arts and styles.

Meaning of Wushu:


Chinese Martial Arts is usually referred to as "Wushu", meaning literally "Martial Arts", in Chinese or "Kung Fu", which means "Accomplishment through hard work and discipline" (the meaning of Kung Fu is more generic and can refer to a high level of skill or accomplishment in any practice including cooking, music, painting, carpentry etc.).  Trademarks of Chinese Martial Arts include movements that involve circles that develops momentum, speed, and fluidity.   Also, TCM (Traditional Chinese Martial Arts) usually does not require the practitioner to be physically stronger or larger than his/her opponent, but rather emphasizes neutralizing or redirecting an opponent's force rather than using force against force.  A third trademark is the emphasis on developing low and strong stances that are held for a long duration of time.  This type of training, though many people are outdated, develops the practitioner's strength, firmness of foot, overall Martial Arts foundation, and functional Martial power.  There are hundreds if not thousands of different styles of Chinese Martial Arts which vary in approach and application.  To find a comprehensive look at Chinese Martial Arts try to Youtube the series: Kung Fu Quest Season 1 & 2.  Though the TV series is in Cantonese Chinese and produced in Hong Kong, the lessons and sparring sessions and two man exercises demonstrate the approach and effectiveness of Chinese Martial Arts.  Have a nice day!  Also, read my bio if I've not bored you to death already! :)

 

Background of Instructor:

Coach Ching-Yin "Bee" Lee has been training in Chinese Martial Arts for almost 20 years, and has been coaching for 10 years. He has coached for O-Mei Wushu Center, University of Maryland's Terp Wushu Club, Niu Martial Arts Academy, and various after school and summer camp programs. Locally, he has received a great deal of his training from Coach Tony Sims, Dr. Lee, and Coach Lu Xiao Lin. He has also traveled abroad and trained with the Guangdong and Guangzhou Wushu team located in Southern China. He received Nanquan (Southern Fist) training from Coaches He Qiang, Ye Jun, Wang Lin, and Chen Yang Ping.

Ching-Yin Lee is a two time US Wushu Team member. In 2003 US Team Trials he earned 2nd place in Nanquan (Southern Fist) and 2nd place in Nangun (Southern Staff), and in 2005 US Team Trials he earned 1st place in Nanquan, and 1st place in Nangun. He also was a silver medalist in Nangun, and a Bronze medalist in Nanquan at the 2004 Pan American Wushu Games.  Ching-Yin is also an amateur kickboxer, an aspiring amateur boxer, and plans on competing in Mixed Martial Arts in the next 2-3 years.

Promo Video:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yhAWrMgYf_o

Pricing:


** Two Free Trials **

$12 per class, or $40 per month for once a week.  $50  per month for twice week.

University of Maryland (Health and Human Performance building) Location:

$5 per class, or $20 per month for once a week.

All 3 locations:

$70 per month for 3 times a week at all locations (or unlimited if there are future locations/class times).

results.description:
ANNAPOLIS SAILORS CLUB

What is ASC?

A group of experienced sailors and sailboat owners that like to support other sailing groups, meet other sailors to be on the water with, learn how to fix our boats (work party days), and do sailing-related stuff out of the general Annapolis and mid-Chesapeake Bay area.

ASC is a great place for
- Skippers to meet crew (day or extended sails)
- Meet other skippers (rafting up and destination sails)
- Experienced crew (variety of sailing opportunities)
- Club focus on continued skill building and fun cruising

ASC is NOT a singles sailing club nor focused on highly competitive racing. We love cruising the Bay and way beyond. We love racing for charity and the lighter side of long Bay races.  Many of our members are active in other sailing and boat clubs.

We enjoy socializing but belong to another club for that. How much sailing does the club do?
190 Active Sailing Members (83+ Sailboat Owners)
640 Total Events (to date from May 2012)
573 (of those events) are sailing or sailing education

What does it cost?
$50 annual for individual (year runs Oct 1st to Sept 30th)
$75 annual for sailing couple

Is ASC right for me?
If you love to sail, have sailing experience at least close to the intermediate level, enjoy diverse, friendly folks, and are comfortable in a clan focused on opportunity more than structure, ASC may be the club for you.


Vicki Hurt, ASC Founder
AnnapolisSailorsClub@yahoo.com

NOTE:  Our meetup site is closed to all but members and is where our primary activities, communications and sailing opportunities are posted.  We do have a FB page for general information:  www.facebook.com/Annapolis.Sailors.Club.
results.name: Annapolis Sailors Club

results.description: Having suffered from Fibromyalgia for over nine years I have found a huge need for face to face real human support from others who also suffer from Fibromyalgia. There is not one specific Fibromyalgia group within the Carroll County area. Depending on the outcome of our first couple meetings we will be changing this tragedy. I was diagnosed with Fibromyalgia in 2006 (but was diagnosed correctly after three years of misdiagnoses), and I have been on a mission of research, knowledge and awareness eversince and most importantly to share all I have learned. As we kno.w Fibromyalgia is not a curable disease, however we have learned Fibromyalgia's symptoms can actually be eliminated through using holistic approaches. This is incredible news for all those suffering. I feel as if I have unlocked the gates of heaven, and I would like to share my journey with you. I refuse to allow Fibromyalgia to ruin my life any further. I have read hundreds of books and seen many, many documentaries, read articles and medical journals, gone to seminars, participated in online seminars and informative classes, concerning these illnesses and concerns of Fibromyalgia, Chronic Pain Syndrome, Western Medicine v/s Eastern Medicine, Holistic Practices of many forms in the help of eliminating and healing the diseases as well as Nutrition and how nutrition factors into your symptoms. I would say after nine years I am extremely knowledgeable within these fields. I am also the creator and administrator of another support group and have many new and exciting groups in the works. Even though Fibromyalgia and Chronic Pain Syndromes are not very well known within the public as well as within the medical fields we are learning more and more every day. We would love if you participated in our excitement in all that has been learned. It would be my pleasure in sharing all I know and help you to eliminate your symptoms. Please come and sit back and enjoy our group! The purpose of the group is to offer face to face support, knowledge, years of research, trial and error within eliminating symptoms with success. The group will provide exciting information, learning, sharing, and teaching our loved ones how to deal with our illness and compassion within Chronic Pain and the symptoms of Fibromyalgia. Everyone who has Fibromyalgia should attend this insightful meeting as well as family members, loved ones and care givers. Anyone curious about the disease that may be doing research may also attend. Be well and we hope to see you at the "Meetup".
results.name: Fibromyalgia and Chronic Pain Syndrome Support

results.description:
What we do: We are a community that offers instruction related to mindfulness meditation, including classes, day long workshops, extended courses (Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction) and occasional weekend retreats. Instructions are designed for both beginners and experienced practitioners.

Most classes and workshops are free for all participants. Although a donation amount is suggested, donations are not required for participation. The MBSR courses are not free, but some scholarship is available.

While the forms of meditation we practice are rooted in Buddhist teachings, the study and practice of mindfulness and insight meditation is applicable to anyone from any background or religion, and all are welcome.

We are affiliated with the Insight Meditation Community of Washington (IMCW) and the teaching of Tara Brach, Jonathan Foust and Hugh Byrne.

Each class will include: guided meditation, instruction, opportunities to practice, and time for discussion, questions and answers.

When and where: Our ongoing drop-in class meets every Tuesday from 7:30-9:00 p.m. on days the school is open at Centennial High School, 4300 Centennial Lane, Ellicott City, MD, 21042, room 406. Please arrive early to settle into your seats - we start right at 7:30 p.m. If you arrive late, please enter as quietly as possible.

Other classes, workshops and courses are provided on an occasional basis. Typically we hold an 8-Week Introduction to Insight Meditation series starting in August, January and April, an 8-Week Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) course three or four times per year, and a daylong workshop every month or two.  To access our schedule, please follow this link:

http://www.meetup.com/Columbia-Insight-Medi...

We practice Insight Meditation, a style of meditation that helps the mind attain deeper levels of calm concentration through sustained attention on the breath, then combines this with the crucial aspect of insight through contemplation of the mind and body and all of their changing and impermanent senses, emotions and thoughts. Insight Meditation trains us to live more fully in the present moment, enables us to experience life from a greater stillness, and aids us in relating to both ourselves and others with increased clarity, compassion, calmness and creativity, and less fear, anxiety and stress.

Along with these and a long list of other psychological benefits, meditation has also been shown to reduce stress hormones in the body, lower blood pressure, reduce anxiety, alleviate depression and boost the immune system.

What we offer: Our ongoing drop-in Tuesday evening classes generally consist of a half hour semi-guided meditation, followed by a talk on Buddhist principles and their application to daily life, followed by discussion and/or practice.

We hold our 8-Week Introduction to Insight Meditation Series starting in August, January and May. These classes run from 6:30 to 7:20 p.m. on Tuesday evenings. Those who attend intro classes are encouraged to stay for at least the half-hour meditation that starts at 7:30 p.m.

We offer workshops (typically day long) to help deepen practice. Some of our workshop topics are: Deepening Insight, a Daylong Silent Workshop; Insight Out Loud (working with partners to deepen insight); A Day of Heart Practices; Deepening Presence; and a Relationship Workshop.

Our 8-Wek Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) courses help students initiate and develop an ongoing daily mindfulness meditation practice. These 8-week courses are designed to help students develop strategies to reduce stress and to relate to their day-to-day experiences in a more calm and creative manner.

We also sponsor Kalyani-Mitta (KM) groups. These are groups that meet outside the normal class hours to discuss Buddhist principles more in depth and to share about how these ideas apply to their personal lives. These groups also help foster deeper connection to other members of the community (sangha).

Teacher:

Stan Eisenstein, a high school teacher who has been meditating for over 25 years and has been practicing Insight Meditation since 2004. Stan is an affiliate teacher with the Insight Meditation Community of Washington (IMCW) and is a graduate of the Meditation Teacher Training Institute, a two-year certification program with senior Insight teachers Tara Brach, Jonathan Foust, Hugh Byrne, and Pat Coffey. He also teaches Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR).

Questions: Please feel free to contact Stan Eisenstein at IMCWColumbia @yahoo.com if you have any questions.

Address: Centennial High School, 4300 Centennial Lane, Ellicott City, MD, 21042, room 406

Parking:

(see parking map below)

The easiest place to park is in the lot on the South side of Centennial High School (on the left side of the building if you are facing the building.

To get there, enter the bus loop (on the south side of the building) and make an immediate left onto a drive that passes through a gate. It looks as though this is an illegal turn, but it is not.

This parking lot is hidden from the road, so it may not be easy to find. If you have trouble parking, park in any lot, enter the building, and then follow the Columbia Insight Meditation Class signs to room 406.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Suggestions:

1. There are plenty of chairs, but if you prefer to sit on the floor, which is not carpeted, please bring a hard pillow or zafu, since, when meditating, it is recommended that your hips be higher than your knees. If you have never tried sitting on the floor during meditation, it is highly recommended that you try the chair first, then practice sitting on the floor at home until you are comfortable.

2. If you have any back issues, please bring a pillow or cushion to place behind you.

3. Please remember to turn off your cell phones before entering the room.

4. Please try not to wear any perfume to the class, as it can be quite distracting to others. Also, with respect to those who may be allergic, we do not use incense.

5. The group is not recommended for those under age 13.

6. If you arrive late, please enter the room as quietly as possible.
results.name: Columbia Insight Meditation Group

More information about Graffiti Warehouse, our pricing, and membership offers can be found at www.graffitiwarehouse.com For street / graffiti artists, we offer XL canvasses and the space to create artwork. results.description:
The Mount Vernon Urbanites is a social organization for young professionals who live or work in the neighborhoods of Mount Vernon & Midtown Belvedere in Baltimore City, Maryland. Exceptions can be made for past or prospective residents.

 

Since our group is really all about neighbors - residents of other Baltimore City neighborhoods are encouraged to join the Baltimore Newbies (for new residents or residents looking for new experiences) or the 20s & 30s Baltimore Nightlife Group - both of which are city-wide groups. If you don't have a connection to Mt. Vernon, please look into these groups. The password below is just to see if people are scanning this or actually reading it. The first word of the password is "Robert." A connection to Mt. Vernon means you live in Mt. Vernon or a surrounding neighborhood: Station North, Bolton Hill, Downtown, Seton Hill. Or you work/study IN Mt. Vernon.

Technically, if you're 20, you are in your 20s. But we ask that all new members be at least 21.

Please upload a photo of yourself & fill out all the profile questions to be accepted as a new member. The second word of the Password is "Mills."

~ * ~ * ~ * ~

 

Our Mission - The Mount Vernon Urbanites connects neighbors to explore and support our community.

Our Goals – Our primary goal is to connect neighbors so they can make friends who live nearby. We believe that a close neighborhood is a much stronger, safer, and more sustainable neighborhood. When urban residents have friends in the neighborhood, they are much more likely to eat, shop, dance, drink, work & workship locally. Residents who are well connected in their community are also more likely to want to support that community – whether it's picking up litter in the park, planting trees, or joining the Community Improvement Association. Lastly, residents who build a neighborhood network are much more likely to buy property and become life-long members of the neighborhood.

Note: The Mount Vernon Urbanites is a membership organization that is completely volunteer run. Membership dues & donations will be used exclusively to pay for the group's operating expenses.

Join us on facebook:

http://www.facebook.com/events/456386417712335/

 

And check out our new website:

www.mvurbanites.com

(seeking writers for features - message John for info)
results.name: 20s & 30s Mount Vernon Urbanites

POSITIVE DMV LESBIANS has two community connections to our organization, the couples/family outreach connection and the singles outreach connection. The opportunity to hang out with other positive singles can provide a beacon in our life. SINGLED OUT will focus on positive community service opportunities outings and fellowship opportunities for the Single LGBT woman. The SINGLED OUT side of Positive DMV Lesbians is not geared towards "hooking people up" or trying to "find a mate" We are strictly focused on supporting the development of a healthy (mind and body), confident, and happy single LGBT women by providing etiquette workshops, rap series (Once a month roundtables), community service projects, game nights, and a number of other fun social activities. We will also partner with the couples and families to exhibit and model healthy and positive relationships. POSITIVE DMV LESBIANS is excited to welcome long time singles, newly Single, and Oh I’m Single people to the SINGLED OUT side of our Organization.

It’s very important for all who wish to join to understand, that we are all mature adults and we will conduct ourselves as such. Doing that requires us all to respect each other’s opinion, space, privacy, and most important the right to make choices and decisions for our own lives. That means NO MOTHERING!!!! Allow people to be adults and make adult like decisions, guidance and mentoring is good but holding hands is BAD!

We will have many events and volunteer opportunities, some will be Family friendly, Couples Only, and Singles Only and we will also feature ME Time events which give us time apart from our families and spouses. So come on and be a part of POSITIVE DMV LESBIANS as we LEARN, GROW and GIVE BACK TOGETHER!

results.description:
Founded in 1967, The Annapolis Naval Sailing Association (ANSA) is a volunteer sailing association and club dedicated to safe recreational sailing on the Chesapeake Bay and to wherever the winds may take us. We base club operations out of Mill Creek near Annapolis, Maryland. Our primary goal is to build competent crew and skippers of larger sailing boats. We train to U.S. Navy standards as formalized by the U.S. Naval Sailing Association, and issue certificates for classroom courses and sailing instruction on the water. We build experience through day cruises, evening cruises, overnight cruises, member personal cruises, and cruises to shore-side restaurants and other points of interest.

ANSA membership is open to all. Some of us have no sailing experience, and some have many years at sea. We have social sailors, able bodied crew, senior crew, watch captains, cruising skippers, and senior skippers. We all love to sail, teach, and share our stories. We sail and maintain a 44-foot Caribbean Sailing Yacht called S/V Fantasea, and some of our members own boats as well. If you have your own boat and need experience or some trained crew, come and  join ANSA. Talk with our members, train and sail with us. Log some hours and build on your sailing experiences. You will be glad you did!

If you are interested in sailing or want to build on your existing sailing skills, we’d like to welcome you aboard.

Additional information and pictures are at http://www.ansa.org
results.name: Annapolis Naval Sailing Association

results.description:
This is the safer soccer subgroup of the regular Washington, DC Pick-up Soccer group.  This subgroup is used to communicate about issues specific to safer soccer.  All members subscribed to organizer messages will receive a weekly email from an organizer (usually Jason Taylor) about safer soccer. However, anyone is welcome to view the past three of seven years of emails archived here.  For safety, all games in this subgroup use a special full-sized very soft foam ball. We play in Silver Spring, Maryland, north of the beltway by about 5 minutes. We have some slots for more players, so feel free to apply to join us. However, we are very, very picky!  Only about ~35% of applicants are accepted!  No soccer experience is required, but do not join if you are injured. The ball is slightly harder to dribble in hot weather. So, why do we use it? One reason is to prevent pain, but another reason has to do with the link between non-concussive heading and growth of a protein called tau. Tau probably strengthens brain tissue, which is good, and probably why this occurs, but in doing so there is probably a permanent loss of mental ability. If you'd like to know more about this, you can read here:

http://healthland.time.com/2012/11/13/study...
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chronic_trauma...
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tau_protein
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SltxL7VbooA (2 minutes)
http://www.pbs.org/wgbh/pages/frontline/lea... minutes 1:24-1:29 (6 minutes)

For reasons we can't discuss here, be skeptical of what you read about this topic. For similar reasons, you are either for our group, or you are against our group (and, by default, for the majority/status quo).

To maximize safety and to help the group overall you should (1) upload a picture so we can call you by your name instead of by "yellow shoes," (2) use your real first and last names, (3) rsvp for any games you might want to attend, (4) also rsvp at http://meetup.com/dcsoccer (where the safer soccer games are again listed among traditional games), and (5) be worthy of being passed to the entire game.  If you want more privacy or can't do those 5 things, that's OK, but it won't be 100% free anymore; before 11am the day of a game you'll need to pay (click "chip in") $5/game/item not completed.

Special Rules

We ref throw ins, corner kicks, kick offs, fouls, yellow cards, etc. We do not allow any player to use their hands for strategic purposes (like a goalie), but some handballs may be legal and desirable, especially if the intent was to protect your face or body from the ball. "Intense fouls", even if "unintentional", especially those "face kicks" resulting in a player's head getting a non-soft hit by anything award 1/2 point to the innocent team, even if it was a same-team foul.  Note that this yields counter-intuitive play: the fouling ("guilty") team kicks off on the kickoff line after such a foul because the "innocent" team just scored.  If you spot a call, like an out of bounds or a foul, calling it also helps the group, and makes it easier for the ref so long as you wait for her to back your initial call.

Next point wins: to make the game fun all the way to the end, if one team is “senior” by 2 or more points when there are 10 minutes left, the “next point wins” rule may begin in which:

    If someone scores, their team wins.

    If nobody scores, the senior team wins.

If you are on the senior team you may wish to play keep away to run out the clock. The captain of the senior team can contest “next point wins” by trying to pick two coin tosses in a row correctly. If they get both correct (25% chance), the game is played out normally.

All American football players new to soccer are encouraged to view this educational video before playing. 

Jason Arthur Taylor, Organizer of Safer Soccer and Washington, DC Pick-up Soccer

P.S.  I respond to all communications made using meetup.com within 48 hours, including applications; if you messaged me for any reason and I didn't respond, I didn't actually get your meetup.com message.
results.name: Co-Ed Safer Soccer

topics.name: Dialogue as a mirror to see our conditioning .
Not self-improvement but observation of the self.
Observing the workings of the self in real time.
Barriers to cooperation. Why can't we get along?
Politics right action and the self.
Watching conflict arise in ourselves and others.
Death psychological time and the self.
Listening deeply and avoiding quick responses.
Dialogue only works with openness and affection.

results.description: The motivation for holding these dialogues is to observe the workings of the self and possible connections to conflict and suffering. We aim to explore together the nature of the self, "What am I?", by looking at the operation of the self in our daily lives. We want to use a leaderless dialogue/inquiry process as a mirror in which we can see our own conditioning and patterns of thought happening in real time. The proposed focus of the dialogue group is not solely on the questions that arise, but also on the thought/emotion/relationship process with which the individual and the group engage the questions. In contrast to debate and discussion, dialogue is not a comparison of opinions or an attempt to convince another of a held conviction. The aim is not problem solving or self-improvement, but observation of the self in action. We encourage avoiding quick responses and listening deeply both to the speaker and to one's own reactions, so that our questions and opinions can appear in a new light. We think dialogue can only work in an atmosphere of affection and openness between the participants. . How it works: A quote or video clip relevant to the dialogue/inquiry into self (from J. Krishnamurti) may be provided as a possible starting point. A period of silence starts the dialogue process. This lasts until someone is moved to start. Then there is a check-in/go-round, with everybody having the chance to speak to what is happening with themselves, possibly in reaction to what they have heard. Then the dialogue proceeds spontaneously.. If too much of the discussion is going on between a few people, someone can ask for a check in to go around and find out what is going on with those not speaking.
results.name: Right Action and the Self: A Krishnamurti-Inspired Dialogue

results.description: This group is for ALL Ladies who live in or around the Baltimore County area, are new in town, Single Ladies, Married Ladies and Ladies who have been in the Baltimore area for a while who are simply looking for a new group to go out or in with. I established this group, with a focus on Inclusion rather than Exclusion. Our purpose would be to bring LGBT Professionals in the Baltimore area , together for socializing, networking, host discussions (Speakers etc) and or dating, with like minded professionals; locally rather than or in addition to, travelling to DC or Philly. The group is open to LGBT Professionals, in the Greater Baltimore Area. All members are Open without a membership fee to post scheduled or impromptu MeetUps and announce them at their leisure rather than wait for the organizer (me or Jay) to approve them. I do not expect to limit or censor the posting or announcing of any meetups unless the members of the on-going bi-weekly meetups find a posting inappropriate.

Come on out and feel welcome!

 

Brian

results.description:
If you're well out of college and find it difficult to make new girlfriends in the adult world or workplace, then this group's for you! As my friends move to other cities or have tighter schedules, I find my time devoted to work, exercise and my boyfriend's social circle... and I won't settle for it! I want to forge my own friendships in a relaxing environment with girls who have similar interests. I'm looking to create a group of young ladies who live close to home (in or near Silver Spring, MD) and want to find sincere friendships. If you like to enjoy a glass of wine, new restaurants, a good read, happy hour, arts/ cultural events, concerts, wine festivals, cooking clubs, laughter with down-to-earth girls, random gatherings after a long day at the office, movie outings, outdoor adventures, themed-nights, making real friends, and more, then welcome! Please don't be shy and jump right in with any suggestions! If there's nothing on the calendar, you have a fun meetup idea, or would like to host an event at your place, let me know... I always appreciate the help :-)

 

Please note that all of the introductory questions are MANDATORY, so failure to fill them in or simply saying your name ("Hi, I'm Lisa", etc) WILL result in a declined membership. We are only interested in sincere requests and attempts at making friends. Also REQUIRED is your $5 yearly dues, so please give them to me at your first Meetup.

 

Final note, please be respectful of the other ladies in this group when you RSVP. We prefer intimate gatherings, so if you RSVP to an event, please show up. I will remove membership for ladies who are inactive for 2+ months and those who've had numerous no-shows.

results.description:
A place for investors to meet face to face in Baltimore County & Baltimore City.  Enjoy a real estate investor networking group focused on connecting you with the local people & resources you need to take your life to the next level.  This Meetup group is focused around doing deals.  No educational products are being sold, but we may give you a few for free. Looking for an investment property to purchase? Join our group.  Want to connect with local real estate millionaires? Make it to your meeting.  Want to learn from the amazing successes and agonizing losses of real investors locally buying and selling properties each month, then I will see you at our next meeting.

Statement of purpose

To build a safe environment to learn from other investors
To create synergy and cooperation among members
To provide solutions for members’ specific challenges
To mastermind new ideas & topics to enhance personal and professional development
To enhance the market position of the members in their industry.
To operate with an abundance outlook
To increase bottom line profitability of the members’ business
To build friendship and camaraderie
To organically grow the group by inviting other like-minded investors to Connected with Investors.


We started this meetup to connect successful and new motivated investors together because we truly believe the people you associate with determine your destiny.

Come meet up with and Connect with real estate investors in your area.

What to bring: A few friends, business cards, your deals, questions about how to do your next or first deals.

Attire: Be yourself ;-)

 

For questions, contact us!  Looking forward to seeing you soon.

Happy Investing,

Ed

443.470.9432

results.description:
Welcome to the NW Washington, DC chapter of the MOMS Club®!

The MOMS Club® is an international nonprofit organization with 1,500+ chapters in seven countries and more than 75,000 members. We are the only international support group specifically for at-home mothers, and we’d like you to be a member, too! Almost all of our activities are during the day, when mothers-at-home need the most support, and children are always welcome at our activities.

If you are a NW Washington, DC resident interested in joining, please contact us at momsclubdc@gmail.com for membership information.

The annual dues are only $30, and the benefits include:

- Monthly meetings with speakers, discussions and socializing,

- Member-hosted casual get-togethers in parks and members’ homes,

- Playgroups for infants, toddlers, preschoolers and school-age children,

- Member-hosted outings to parks, museums, exhibits and concerts,

- Craft time & music time to create something fabulous and to make music, sing and dance with the kids,

- Babysitting co-op where members trade babysitting hours. You must belong to the MOMS Club for two months before becoming eligible for the co-op,

- Activity groups such as MOMS Night Out and a Book Club,

- Holiday parties,

- Helping hands (volunteers provide meals for a fellow MOM and her family in times of need), and

- Service projects to help women and children in our community.

Also, look under "Pages" tab for more information.

Not a NW DC resident? There's probably a MOMS Club chapter near you. Visit the international MOMS Club web site at http://www.momsclub.org.

If you're interested in being a speaker at our monthly meeting, please send us an email.

We look forward to hearing from you!
results.name: MOMS Club® of NW Washington, DC

results.description:
You have read all the books, graduated from religion, atheism, eastern and western philosophy. Now you want to get out of your mind!  You want to fearlessly practice your most important muscle, daily, every moment.  Like many of us you might be a battle-hardened warrior who never used your most effective weapon. If you are ready to live according to the way of heart, this group may be a good station on your journey.

The way of Heart is the way of Life.  It can help you realize all your dreams. For me, it helped me come up with even better dreams. Highly interactive and electrifying gatherings, magical music, food, and conversations with Mehrdad Mizani.

These gatherings predate the Meet Up group, so every session we have at least a dozen or more earlier members, who haven't gotten used to signing up for sessions, showing up.  While you are welcome to show up too, it is best to register so the host knows how many people to expect at the residence where the meeting is being held.  Also, it will help people who (optionally) want to bring food, to size and coordinate the effort.

results.description:
~ come as you are, move as you wish ~

Bardo Dance and Bardo Flow (formerly Conscious Dance Annapolis) offer opportunities to express yourself authentically through movement. Bardo is a Tibetan word for gap, a place of transformation in several forms. We draw inspiration from these Bardo states to create places of growth and change to shift our lives in healthy ways.

Each event is unique in the fun, loving, and open space it creates. Our events begin with gentle, grounding music which builds to include a variety of tempos and genres. Events end quietly and sweetly, encouraging meditation and reflection.

We select and arrange our music with a mindfulness of the body’s main seven chakras. These seven energy centers are recognized by many cultures around the world as places to focus awareness and healing. Growth, transformation, and healing happen through movement and music!

Bardo Dance was created in 2007 and we are grateful to be growing our community!


Bardo Dance is offered Monday and Friday mornings: 8:30-9:30am
(Drop in price or use a class card).
(http://www.ridgelyretreat.com/schedule.htm)

Bardo Flow is usually held on the second Saturday of each month: 7:30-9/9:30pm, $15
(http://www.ridgelyretreat.com/specialevents.htm, http://www.facebook.com/consciousdanceannapolis or this page)

Both at the lovely Ridgely Retreat:

203 Ridgely Ave
Annapolis, MD 21401

results.description:
We are DC-area technology entrepreneurs and innovators who want to build viable and vibrant business based on hardware, whether electronic, mechanical, or other.

Atoms are the new bits: We believe that the time is ripe for a new wave of entrepreneurship in hardware in the United States and worldwide.

Lean startup / pretotype methodologies: Thanks to inexpensive contract manufacturing, domestic and overseas, 3D printing, programmable hardware, and an Internet to propagate ideas, the principles of "lean startup" methodologies are as applicable to hardware startups as to software startups. Hardware "minimal viable products (MVPs)" can be build in weeks or days, and "pretotypes" can often be formulated in just hours or even minutes.

Identify the right product to build before you mass produce: This classic rule still holds. How can we identify the right hardware product to build without expending too many resources?

Unique challenges for hardware: Hardware startups have their own unique logistic challenges- inventory management, component sourcing, and manufacturing to name a few. We will discuss and learn how to handle these issues as well.

Inventor to entrepreneur: We hardware folks love to tinker and invent. This is pure fun! Can we apply this tinkering mindset to build business, not just gizmos?

If your product moves, flies, makes a sound, has blinking lights, or does something physical, come join us!
results.name: DC Hardware Startup

Are you looking to meet other fun women in our area who love to read and discuss good books over a glass of wine or a cup o' joe? If so, this is the group for you!

We will read a variety of books....fiction or non-fiction, paperback or hardcover....chick lit or classic literature...anything goes. Each month we will read a new book and then get together to discuss it in a different location.

We are looking for active members only. We do not expect all of our members to attend every month, but we do have an attendance policy. This group promotes a friendly, warm, low-key atmosphere. Come to laugh, share stories, grab a drink and make new friends.  This is a group for women only.

To view our past events, please click here.

If you are interested in joining our amazing group, please do the following:

1. Review the group's guidelines here.
2. Answer all profile questions.
3. We ask that members have a recognizable photo of themselves. This is required for group safety reasons and it will make it easier for members to identify each other when our Meetups are in public locations.

Choosing not to complete the information requested above may result in the denial/delay of your membership request.

At this time, we are not open to new members.  If you are interested in joining, please sign up and we will contact you when we have available spots.


 "To learn to read is to light a fire; every syllable that is spelled out is a spark." — Victor Hugo, Les Miserables

results.description:
The Virtuous Woman's Institute is a Christian-based forum and consortium of women's ministries, organizations and service providers, established to educate, enlighten and empower women during the various stages of life using resources based on Godly Wisdom found in Proverbs 31:10-31.

 

Vision
The Virtuous Woman's Institute will encourage each woman

  • to find her worth through the Word of God and
  • to work diligently to build His Kingdom,

so that she might improve the quality of her life and the lives of those around her.
Mission
To help women learn and grow in Godly Wisdom through all phases of life.

 

Goals

to establish and maintain a consortium of women’s ministries, organizations, and service providers that will be a one-stop shop for all biblically-based training on female issues. The VWI will sponsor and identify seminars, conferences, workshops, etc. on issues facing girls, teens, young adults, mature adults, and seniors on managing and maintaining the affairs of their lives that includes their homes, businesses, families, relationships, ministries, churches, schools, etc.

results.description:
Unallocated Space (UAS) is an active hackerspace location in Anne Arundel County (Severn, MD) that supports the DC / Baltimore Metro Area. As an open technology-based community lab, we invite you to share your creativity!

Our mission is to foster our community to "Teach, Learn, Build”. Our 1600+ sq.ft. space is minutes from BWI, between Baltimore and Washington DC. Equipped with a wide range of tools, UAS welcomes DIY tech enthusiasts of all skill levels and interests. Our space enables everyday people to share ideas and work on group and individual projects. Our facility has resources that support electronics (soldering, circuits), fabrication (wood, plastics, metal), and is fully wired/wireless network with a VM lab for network experiments.  Our classroom can handle 30+ students and hosts courses in electrics, web development, programming and computer networking.

Our members offer a steady stream of free and public events, classes, activities, and anything that gets people building, making, and learning.  We serve the community on 100%donated funds as a non-profit organization. For more information, visit unallocatedspace.org for upcoming events or contact

info {at} unallocatedspace {dot} org

Any groups looking to organize a public event at Unallocated, please contact:

events {at} unallocatedspace {dot} org

FYI nearly every event posted has had 10+ people regardless of the number of people meetup lists.
results.name: Unallocated Space

So if you are facing challenges with MySQL or Postgres or Oracle and want to explore a more flexible, scalable, and fun alternative, please join us at one of our monthly sessions.

The Node follows the Hackerspace model that is flourishing in cities around the world, including New York, Chicago, San Francisco, Berlin, Sydney, and many more. Members receive 24/7 access to the space, which is stocked with shared and donated tools and equipment. In addition to the informal exchange of wisdom and experience that comes from simply working in a shared space, the Node sponsors regular workshops and events on a broad range of topics. http://baltimorenode.org

results.description:
Are you interested in exploring, studying and practicing meditation in the Himalayan yoga tradition?  A small group or groups will meet regularly to pursue spiritual growth through meditation. Our time will be split between exploration and study of the traditional 8-fold path of yoga based on the Yoga Sutras of Patanjali and the practices on that path, with the focus always on meditation.


Prayag is a Sanskrit word meaning a confluence or joining of sacred streams or rivers. Each of us is such a sacred stream carrying our own spiritual experience and background. By coming together we create a group energy that is greater than, and transcends, what an individual can achieve. My goal for the Baltimore Prayag Center for Spiritual Growth is to create a kalyana-mitra (spiritual friendship) which provides support to one another along the spiritual path while learning and practicing together.


I am a student/initiate of the Himalayan Yoga Tradition taught by Sri Swami Rama. I have been studying, practicing and teaching for many years. My current teacher in the tradition, Swami Veda Bharati, suggested that I start a group “. . . of like-minded people walking on a pilgrimage in life.” I am happy to share what I have learned over the years, but my hope is that we will also each contribute so that the combined wisdom of the group will guide us along the way. In addition to meditation techniques we will explore and work with the Așțau Angāni (eight means to yoga): Yama – restraints or social disciplines that regulate our relationship with other beings; Niyama – observances for oneself or individual disciplines; Āsana – seat or posture; Prānāyāma – breath awareness, expansion or control; Pratyāhāra – mastery over external influences and the senses; Dhāranā – concentration; Dhyāna – meditation; and Samādhi – the state of unity which is the goal.


I am looking forward to discovering what develops as the group grows together. Some future possibilities that come to mind are bringing distinguished teachers to town for seminars or retreats, or taking trips together to other meditation centers.

In loving service,

Steve
results.name: Baltimore Prayag: A Center for Meditation & Spiritual Growth

We’re assuming there are others like us out there and we’d love to meet you! We enjoy one another’s company but it’s always great to have some couple friends to hang out with too. We’ll be planning all kinds of events, some with just a few couples and some with a big group so feel free to jump in wherever you feel comfortable. results.description:
Interested in just hanging out in New York City or Philadelphia for a day? Want to venture north of Baltimore but don't have anyone to travel with? Then join the Baltimore to New York Travel Group!

We will be traveling to cities such as New York, Philadelphia, Boston, and other Northeast destinations, including Canada and the Mid-Atlantic.  We will be taking trips through the Megabus or Boltbus services, which offer very low-cost bus trips that you can purchase on their websites (www.megabus.com and www.boltbus.com). Our destinations will include neighborhoods, points of interests, events, and other important and exciting places to see. We will also find a place to dine out before boarding back on the bus.

I am also open for suggestions for places to see in the areas mentioned above or any place north of Baltimore. Our events will be scheduled once a month.

 

*Check out Maryland Urban Food Tours, my new food tour company.  We will be taking exciting neighborhood tours of historic and unknown Baltimore neighborhoods while tasting the unique dishes that the neighborhood restaurants have to offer.  Visit www.mdurbanfoodtours.com for more information.
results.name: Baltimore to New York Travel Group

results.description:
SHAKESPEARE LOVERS - Chevy Chase, MD

"Shakespeare Lovers" is dedicated to studying and savoring a single play of Shakespeare's per season, followed by a post-reading DVD Party to wrap up each cycle! The plays are usually chosen based on what is being performed at either the Shakespeare Theatre or the Folger Theatre during a given season. My goal for the group is to ensure a focus on Shakespeare's own words - chosen for their poetic beauty, their wisdom, or both - to facilitate our discussions and commentary. Via prepared "handouts" filled with quotes, we delve into the Bard's profound artistic legacy. Great art is a wonderful way to nurture our inner beings and I hope the group would help facilitate such experiences for you! As organizer, I trained and work in the visual arts (art and architecture), however, having moved to London-UK as a teenager, was also exposed to a healthy dose of great theatre via parents who were keen on instilling culture in their kids from an early age. A love for great literature also happens to define my Persian (Iranian) heritage's national character, with Persian literature having been used as a guide-to-life tool for centuries, and in turn, having made falling for Shakespeare an effortless experience! (I've been dedicated to the bard since seeing Jeremy Irons at the RSC in London in 1987...) Our "Shakespeare Lovers" group continues to attract a fascinating mix of people from all walks of life. Feel free to sign up and join our little circle! 

A favorite quote from Macbeth: (I love the little warning shot from Banquo) - How we're often tricked and enticed by half-truths, or trivial truths, in order to be won over by a bigger wickedness:

"And oftentimes, to win us to our harm,

The instruments of darkness tell us truths,

Win us with honest trifles, to betray’s

In deepest consequence."

MACBETH - Banquo from Act I sc. iii
results.name: Shakespeare Lovers - Chevy Chase, MD

This is a hybrid group exercise class and turbocharged all-levels tennis clinic with social event to follow (socials occur on the monthly special events and other select sessions)

Have a ton of fun running your butt off! Doesn’t matter if you never picked up a racquet in your life or played competitive tennis, the high intensity hitting drills and games will help you learn and improve while burning lots of calories!

Sessions are led by certified tennis pros and fitness trainers using tennis courts and surrounding area featuring equipment such as TRX, medicine balls, bands, agility ladders, mini-hurdles, parachute resisted runs and other portable and effective fitness equipment. Tennis racquets and balls are also provided. Some classes even provide loaner Polar heart rate monitors so you can see your caloric expenditures and optimize anaerobic/aerobic training.

Since the sessions are professionally instructed, there may be a small fee  to cover these costs for the 90 min class, plus an additional complimentary 30-60 minutes of optional "speed-tennis" round robin games. Host-catered socials have a cost-covering additional small charge. Our sessions are a productive and positive place to share issues and get regular feedback. results.description:
Pathfinder Society, the organized play arm of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, is thriving Baltimore! Join us at a variety of locations around Baltimore as we continue to Explore, Report, and Cooperate across the Inner Sea!

About Pathfinder Society Organized Play

In an organized play campaign, your character exists in a common setting shared by thousands of other gamers from around the world. In each Pathfinder Society game, your character experiences adventures in two different ways. The first is a short, one-sitting adventure (or "scenario") that is a single episode in a continuing story and generally lasts four to five hours. The second is a longer, multi-session adventure (or "module") that is a single adventure but can take anywhere from eight to twelve hours to play.

You can take your character to any public Pathfinder Society event anywhere in the world, and while the Game Master and your companions might change every time you play, your character advances as normal. Over time, campaigning in an organized play environment offers a uniquely immersive experience, as your diverse companions add depth and character to the campaign world. It's also a great way to get in touch with other local gamers, meet new people, and play regularly without all the prep work and scheduling of a traditional campaign. Your local regional coordinator (also called a Venture-Captain or Venture-Lieutenant) can assist you in finding or setting up your own Pathfinder Society event.

Alternatively, some players prefer to keep their Pathfinder Society experience limited to a familiar group of friends, using the Pathfinder Society character creation rules, adventure scenarios, and reward structure as the framework for a private campaign. Either approach is a valid way to experience the campaign, and many players enjoy a combination of public and private adventuring.

Because Organized Play takes place in a shared-world environment, additional rules are required to ensure that all players at all tables share a similar experience, no matter who is running the game. The Guide to Pathfinder Society Organized Play outlines these special rules, ensuring a level playing field for all. Please read over the contents of this guide carefully.

How do I get started?

All Pathfinder Society players must register themselves and their characters online. When you register on the My Pathfinder Society page, you'll receive an official Pathfinder Society Number. Keep your Pathfinder Society Number handy and bring it with you to every Pathfinder Society event you attend. Paizo uses this number to record the adventures your character has completed and the prestige she has gained. Each character you create has a unique number appended to your Pathfinder Society Number, so if your number is 10222, the second character you create will be 10222–2.

If you don't have time to create a new character or simply wish to try out a new character class, you may choose to use one of several level-appropriate pregenerated characters available or from your local event coordinator. If you play a 1st-level pregenerated character, you can apply the credit for her first adventure to a newly created character of your very own.

Where can I play?

Once you've got a Pathfinder Society Number and have created your character, you're ready to play your first Pathfinder Society scenario or module! The easiest way to find a local game is to join this Meetup and RSVP for one of the upcoming Meetups on this site with an advertised level range for a level 1 character. The level range will be listed at the end of the Meetup title in parenthesis such as (1-2),(1-5) or (1-7).

What do I have to bring?

At a minimum you'll need a character sheet with all of your character information and details as well as an inventory tracking sheet which you can Download Here. You'll also need to bring a copy of your Pathfinder Society Number (it's a good idea to write it somewhere on your character sheet), a set of 7 polyhedral dice, a pencil, a 1-inch scale miniature or token to represent your character on a combat grid, and a copy of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook. Other players may be able to lend you dice or a miniature for the gaming session if you don't have any, but eventually you'll want to get a set of your own. The only thing left needed is a desire to roleplay and have have fun!

I hope to see you at the gaming table soon,

Venture Captain Matt Hudson
Baltimore, MD Lodge

results.description:
Real Estate Money Meetup - Baltimore, MD

This is a real estate investor networking group for the Greater Baltimore, MD area and a place to meet investors who have the same interests as you. This is a structured networking event. Nothing to sell, no sales pitches, no books, no boot camps, no DVDs, no class time. 

We will spend some time learning about private investment dollars, retirement plan dollars and how to find those sources.I regularly hear from investors that they want to meet other people who have similar goals and interests. At any event I attend, participants always request more networking time. So, here it is. All networking and no distractions.

It has been said many times that your net worth is a reflection of your network. By coming to this meetup, you'll learn how others network and how to improve your own. Here are a few suggestions to help create a successful Meetup.

1. Come prepared, have business cards, bring something to take notes with and rehearse your introduction.
2. Know how you can help others and how they can help you.
3. This time is not about selling deals. It is about meeting people and creating opportunities during your followup with a new connection you make at the event.
4. Have a followup plan in place.
5. Invite someone already in your network - be a go giver to become a go getter.
results.name: Real Estate Money MeetUp - Baltimore, MD

Also, we are a fun group and appreciate an upbeat attitude. Considering the number of activities and participants, we have virtually no major issues with any of our events. occasionally things don't go exactly as planned, but we still always have a great time, and everything works out. Remember that the organizers are VOLUNTEERS and work very hard to plan and carry out activities for a numbers of people. We look forward to meeting you and hope you have a lot of fun with our group.

You are not here by accident, but have arrived to deepen your relationship with God, study His Word to gain understanding, and apply Biblical applications to your real life issues - the topics not regularly discussed or avoided in church and more traditional Bible studies.

This is a Non-Denomenational Women's Bible Study for women facing real life issues and will use Biblical applications to live a life of prosperity, victory and success. All are welcome - those who have participated in Women's Bible Study and those whom have never participated - come so we can all learn and grow in God's Word together. If you have ever wanted to learn more about God's Word and be in an informal, non-traditional learning environment, with other women who are seeking understanding with frank, open discussions about any and all issues that impact women, their families and society, then this is the place for you! results.description:
Do you love brunch (and other meals) but hate getting up early in the morning? Do you want to meet new people and expand your social circle, while eating the best meal of the day? If so, this group is for you!

Membership Dues

There is an annual membership fee of $4. We use the fee to pay Meetup's hosting cost (180$ annually), since we have no other overhead it ensures the member fee is kept low. When you are first approved for the group, you get a 30 day grace period during which you can attend brunches without paying the fee. Note that outside the 30 day free exemption, you must pay and be in good standing to attend. If after 30 days you choose not to pay dues, you will be removed from the group.

If you aren't able to attend a brunch during your month, send a message to me (Forrest) and I'll give you an extension.

Guidelines for Brunch Attendance

Since most of our events involve reservations, please do your best to attend when you RSVP. Our policy is as follows:

-You can change/cancel your RSVP for any reason up to 24 hours before any event.

-If you must cancel within 24 hours, please contact the organizer directly and explain what came up. This may allow for the reservation to be changed etc. Not contacting the organizer within 24 hours is grounds for possible expulsion.

-No shows are automatically expelled from the group. If something terrible came up and you weren't able to or didn't have time to contact the organizer, get in touch and we'll let you back in.

As a rule we don't allow +1s since we charge a small fee for membership. If you want to bring someone to an event who is not a member of the group, contact the organizer. While we're generally happy to welcome folks on a one-time basis, if they want to come regularly they must join the group and pay the fee.

Organizers decide on an individual basis which kind of waitlist to use. If the event is under an automatic waitlist (i.e. people from the list are automatically signed up when someone drops out) please be aware that you may be RSVPed for the event at any time and the usual attendance rules will apply. If you're on one of these waitlists and know you can't make it, please take yourself off.

Although it is often possible to split checks, please consult the event page as some places do not divide bills for larger groups, a few only accept cash, and finally some will only take a certain number of cards per group. In these cases please bring enough cash to pay for what you order. Unless otherwise stated, it should be possible to pay however you like.

Since our events tend to be limited in size, they often fill up quite quickly. We encourage anyone who wants to go to get on the waitlist, since many people will change their minds prior to the event. As well, we know to go more often with larger groups to places where many people want to come!

Do your best to arrive near the scheduled start time of the event, keep in mind the parking conditions in the area the event is being held and/or any metro closures. Some places are very strict when it comes to seating groups prior to the arrival of the whole party, and it's generally problematic to have to wait a long time to order etc. so it's not nice to be late. Generally speaking, we try to order within 15-20 minutes of the posted event time even if some folks haven't arrived. Frequent excessive lateness may be grounds for expulsion. 

Other Group Info

Exercise common courtesy when attending brunches, we reserve the right to expel anyone for rude or disrespectful behavior at events.

Organizers reserve the right to change or cancel events. Please read any correspondence from us if you've RSVPed to something.

If you are interested in being an event organizer, please let me know; the more organizers we have, the more brunches we can have! It's a really fun and easy way to eat more brunches and meet more fun people!
results.name: Lazy DC Brunchers

results.description: I love reading books aimed at a young audience, and I know other people must, too! Let's revisit old favorites like _A Wrinkle in Time_ and the _Half Magic_ series, as well as new classics like _When You Reach Me_, _Will Grayson, Will Grayson_, and _Marcello in the Real World_. We can also consider questions where we benefit from adulthood/hindsight, such as... Do you like _The Lion, The Witch, and The Wardrobe_ any better or worse now that you know it's all Christian allegory? How in the world did Orson Scott Card predict the entire Internet and blogosphere in _Ender's Game_? I'm hoping to get together once a month (or maybe six weeks or two months... we're all busy) in coffee shops in the Mt Washinton/Hampden/Charles Village/Mt Vernon areas with a book to discuss and some sweet treats to eat. Weekend afternoons are usually best.

topics.name: Creativity Workshop for Artists of All Disciplines

results.description:
The concept behind this Meetup is not a new one; artists have always collaborated with one another to stoke their creative fires by reacting artistically to each others work. In this case, the idea is for each artist to bring a sketchbook, begin a drawing, then have that sketchbook rotated through everyone else at the table, allowing the other artists to add to, and finish the drawing.

You don't have to be a good artist to participate; the end result will be interesting no matter what, and even a "bad drawing" can inspire creativity in others.

This is an exercise in creative action & productivity, not necessarily contemplation; therefore I thought it would be necessary to implement a time-limit--but since a timer doesn't really feel very natural in a creative environment, we'll use a 'musical chairs' system, and rotate after each song ends. A non-drawing participant will play DJ (or we will meet at a venue with music on the sound system) and indicate when it is time to switch sketchbooks.

I thought it would make sense to mix-up the time-limits, so that artists would have enough time to properly begin a drawing, but also be regulated by time later on to encourage speed and action in their work. So the person to start a drawing would have perhaps 4 songs (about 16 minutes) to start a drawing, then the next would have 3, the next 2. Once the drawings are being rotated every single song, they would continue at this rate until the sketchbook arrives at it's original owner. A single session would last around 45 minutes.

At this point we would take a break and share the work with the group, and perhaps scan them in for posting in the Meetup gallery. Then, for those interested, we can continue to do additional sessions until everyone gives up and goes home.

Any dry, clean medium (pen, pencil, crayon) is acceptable; please do not use wet mediums (paint, glue, watercolors) or anything that is exceptionally messy (charcoal), because some people might not want to carry their sketchbook home with stuff dripping or falling out of it.

Even with this in mind, please remember that you are bringing your own sketchbook for possible strangers to draw in; so make sure you start your drawing on a page where the drawing behind it on the next page won't be damaged by, for example, markers that bleed through or the indentations of harshly applied pencils.

Some additional rules to consider:

  1. You may only erase pencil work by another artist for the purpose of integrating it with new artwork (e.g., if the new art overlaps a portion of the old art).
  2. Do not completely erase or otherwise cover any other artwork from previous turns (this includes anyone else's artwork, but also your own from previous turns)
  3. If you work in pencil, be aware of rule #1
  4. Anyone may color anyone else's uncolored artwork
  5. Anyone may ink in anyone else's pencil artwork

By the way... It costs $15 a month to run this Meetup page, so if you don't mind making some contribution (you can just buy me a couple beers) it would be appreciated!
results.name: 'Sketchbook Jam' Collaborative Sessions

Continuing Education Seminars and Health and Wellness Programs for consumers, medical and design/build professionals, educators, OTs, PTs, SLPs, and physicians.  Register for a seminar and download brochures on www.aotss.com. This site does not represent the number of participants or the details of each conference, just a venue for reaching professionals who could benefit from knowing about our CE seminars and programs. .

Our health and wellness programs provide venues to nurture yourself with healing and creative activities focused on empowering your ability to maintain mental, emotional, physical and energetic wellbeing and balance. Take time to meet, learn, and grow with others. Creative activities focus on managing stress, increasing energy, and improving memory, learning & working productivity.

Training programs include the following specialty areas and topics: Irlen Method,  Brain Gym Exercises, sensory integration,  The Listening Program, Emotional Freedom Technique (EFT), professional development (CEUs), home/worksite modifications/ergonomics, injury prevention, home safety, advocacy, special education consulting, Orton Gillingham Tutoring, organizational skills,  and much more.

Sessions may be covered by your health insurance under occupational therapy coverage. CEUs available for professionals.  Group and early registration discounts available.  All seminars, unless otherwise specified, are held in our Pikesville, MD office.

results.description:
Over getting wasted at parties every weekend?
Not quite resigned yourself to a life of
crocheting toilet paper covers and talking to your plants?

Then come be social and fun with us!

We're a group of mostly single, mostly child-free women in our 30s (but we welcome everyone), living around Howard County, Baltimore City/County, Montgomery County, and Anne Arundel County.

Past Meetups Have Included:
Happy Hours/Dinners
Book clubs
Food Truck Festivals 
Winery/Brewery Tours and Tastings
Local Art and Music Festivals
Movies
Day trips to beaches, gardens, and parks
Spa days

..... really anything that is fun awesome girlfriend type stuff! :)

Our Guidelines
(please read before joining!)

1) If plans change, and you cannot make an event you RSVP'd ''Yes" to, please be considerate of the people attending, on the wait list, and/or hosting the event, and update your RSVP to "No" at least 24 hours prior to the event.

(This is the only time to RSVP as a "No" - if you are *changing* your RSVP. Please do not RSVP "No" in advance to every event listed on the entire calendar you already know you can't attend.)

2) If you do not show up to an event without giving 24 hours notice, you will be counted as a "No Show."

3) People who "No Show" 3 times, will be put on restriction and will not be able to RSVP or attend events for 3 months. The Event Organizers definitely understand that situations can come up at the last minute that you can't always control, which is why we give you 3.

4) "No shows" will eventually be removed from members account, based on your attendance at other events.

5) To cover the cost the organizers pay Meetup.com to run the group, we ask for members to contribute $2.50 in yearly dues. Please pay your dues within 3 weeks of joining (and then by Oct 1 each year after), or you will be removed from group events (especially those where paid members are on the wait list) until you pay. The link to pay is on the left side of the page.

Note: You might also be able to arrange to buy me a beer at one of our events in exchange for dues. Just arrange this in advanced so you aren't removed from an event and so I don't have 5 people offering me a beer at one event. ;)

6) A clear picture of your face is required to join the group, so we can recognize you at events.

These policies have been put into place to encourage respectfulness and active participation in the group.

Thank you for your attention to these policies! :)
results.name: 30s Girlfriends: Howard County

results.description:
This is a non-denominational book club, but mostly draw on books that could be called "Modern Buddhism". Just like any other book club, we are reading down a list of books on the topic of Buddhism and we discuss them at restaurants and cafe's near Takoma Park.

How Much to Read

For a discussion that everyone can enjoy, attendees are required to read at least half the book or the corresponding historical text if available.

You don't need to be self identifying Buddhist to participate and the organizer will not pressure you to "join the club." If you would like to mention your favorite local buddhist group, you still must read the book to attend. All community announcements will be held to the end of the meetup. *Proselytizing, even if you are being nice about it, is off topic.*

Upcoming Book List (as of Nov-2013)

results.description:
Welcome to Cool Chick's Bunko! You have been accepted into the group because you are a COOL CHICK and like to have fun with friends! We don't take Bunko too seriously, it's just a chance to get together for a girl's nite out to catch up on each other's lives, find camaraderie, share stories, laugh, and have a few drinks...

We meet on the third Tuesday of each month of the year with members taking turns hosting in their homes.

TIME:  Gathering time is  at 7:30pm, to chat, grab a bite to eat, and get a drink. Playing Bunko begins +/- at 8:00pm.We end anywhere between 9:30pm and 10:00pm.

COST: $10

GUIDELINES: The host provides drinks, appetizers and dessert -- store-bought, home-made, whatever works for you and your schedule. (i.e., chips/dip, munchies, cookies or cake, etc.); usually host also provides nibbles for each table (e.g. nuts, pretzels, chex mix, M&Ms). Host sets up 3-4 tables to seat 4 players each. There is a Bunko game to be passed around every month with the Bunko hat.  Please RSVP as early as you can and try not to cancel at the last minute!

WHAT TO BRING: Your sense of humor, $10, a smile, maybe even some sarcasm! Please leave politics & religion at home ;)

GUIDELINES: Regular members pick one month to host.

PRIZES: Awarded at the end of the night for: 1) Most wins, 2) 2nd most wins, 3) Most bunkos, 4) Most losses (Biggest Loser).  If there are four tables, we add 5) Last bunko &/or 6) Middle of road = 6 Wins, 6 Losses.

*** New rule *** Only one winner per prize category. If one person wins more than one, the prize will go to the next runner up.
results.name: Cool Chick's Bunko (Greater Olney, MD)

results.description:
The Social Anxiety Support Group for DC, MD, and VA meets twice a month on Saturdays from 10:00 am to 11:30 am.  On the first Saturday of every month, we meet at the Tenley-Friendship Library (Conference Room 1).  On the third Saturday, we meet at the Martin Luther King Library (Room 221a).  Support group meetings are open to anyone with social anxiety.  At the meetings, we share our experiences living with and overcoming social anxiety.

STUDENTS who are seeking COLLEGE CREDIT by studying support groups (for psychology, social work, or other mental health classes) are not welcome to attend our meetings for observation.  Thanks for understanding our shyness. PLEASE NOTE: if you are a student who has social anxiety and would like to come to the meeting as a participant -- and not for course credit -- you are welcome to attend.

Through this meetup group, support group members also schedule social gatherings.  These social events help bridge the gap between support group meetings and "being social in the real world." We often host events after our bimonthly support group meetings, but also on on other occasions as well.

We also now host a monthly discussion of content from the Shyness and Social Anxiety Workbook by Martin Antony and Richard Swinson.

For more information about the support group, please see our website: http://www.angelfire.com/md3/socialanxietyg...
results.name: DC Social Anxiety Support Group & Events

results.description:
Greetings!

This Meditation and Study Group is a group belonging to the Palyul School of Tibetan Buddhism. Palyul is one of the six great "mother monasteries" following the Nyingma School, or Ancient Translation Tradition, of Tibetan Buddhism. The monastery was founded in 1665 in the Kham province of eastern Tibet (present-day Baiyu, Sichuan, China) by Kunzang Sherab, the First Palyul Throne Holder.

The purpose of this study group is to offer regular meditation opportunities along with classes lead by Palyul Khenpos (Professors) or senior students. Classes are taken from the Palyul Shedra (University) as well as material compiled from the International Buddhist College (such as our Buddhism 101 class).

Meditation sessions include traditional sitting/walking meditation as well as sessions for Palyul students working on specific practices (such as Ngondro). Regular celebration practices will also be conducted, such as feast offering practices and holiday practices. All of this means there will be opportunities for people who are interested in simply meditating as well as practice opportunities for people who wish to take their meditation practice to the next level!
results.name: Harford-Baltimore County Buddhist Meditation & Study Group

results.description:

ZUMBA burns fat, tones your body, lifts your spirit and puts a smile on your face.

No dance or fitness experience necessary to enjoy ZUMBA. Everyone is guaranteed to have fun and get a good workout! All ages, shapes and sizes welcome! Ditch the treadmill, join the party!

Please check my class schedule on www.ZumbaElena.com and join in the fun. You are only one hour away from a better mood!

Naptown Photo was created and is organized by Jennifer Casey (www.jennifercaseyphotography.com). Jen is a local professional photographer who is always happy to share her love for photography.

Over the last year Naptown Photo has grown to over 350 members and has offered just shy of 100 meet ups!

We have a nominal yearly membership fee of $5 dollars. Our membership will run on a calendar year. Each month you will have access to 3 free social meet ups in addition to fun online events as well.

In addition you will see workshop offered at very affordable pricing. You are not obligated to partake in paid workshops but the resource is there if you become interested.

Please take a moment and look at our past events and reviews then join us for some photography fun!

See you soon!

Jen Casey

Naptown Photo creator and organizer

www.jennifercaseyphotography.com

www.facebook.com/photographybyjennifercasey

topics.name: Restoring the US Constitution in Government

results.description: We're working in Maryland, locally, state-wide, and nationally, on a constitutional amendment overturning the 'Citizens United' decision, and related reforms including the American Anti-Corruption Act, Congressman Sarbanes' Grassroots Democracy Act, etc. We're committed (or ought to be), and we're in it for the long term. Some of us have experience in grassroots organizing. Fighting institutionalized corruption is non-partisan, is supported by the left and the right, and we'll need both sides to win. (The folks involved so far are progressives, but all are welcome). Our meetings feature food, fellowship, fun and infotainment. (Oh yes, and we could use your help).

results.description: The Baltimore Tall Club, Inc. is a non-profit social organization whose purpose is to promote Tall fellowship. We sponsor and participate in many types of activities and events, including happy hours, dinners, sporting events, and charity events. BTC is a member of Tall Clubs International (TCI) and the North East Association of Tall Organizations (NEATO). We serve the state of Maryland as the on ly active Maryland chapter of Tall Clubs International. We actively support and raise money for the National Marfans Foundation. results.description:
This is a popular science book club; we meet monthly (on the last Wednesday of the month) to discuss a non-fiction book.

The group is modelled on the Herndon VA Science Book Club, so we'll read books that are interesting, thought-provoking, and educational.  The goal is to have some thought-provoking fun.  Some books we've already read include:

    "Rabid: A Cultural History of the World's Most Diabolical Virus", by Bill Wasik and Monica Murphy.

    Mary Roach's "Packing For Mars: The Curious Science of Life in the Void"

    "A Universe From Nothing: Why There Is Something Rather than Nothing", by Lawrence M. Krauss.

    Deborah Blum's "The Poisoner's Handbook"

    Sam Kean's "The Disappearing Spoon"

We meet at 7PM on the last Wednesday of the month, at the Panera at Bowie Town Center. Members aren't obliged to attend every meeting; you can choose to read only those books that appeal to you.

The group doesn't focus on any particular scientific field, so all of biology, medicine, chemistry, physics, geology, astronomy, mathematics, etc. are within its scope.

topics.name: Anglo Saxon or Germanic or Norse Religion

results.description:
Have you ever found yourself on a walk in the forest and suddenly come to a place that immediately felt special? Maybe there was some uniquely shaped rock or a tree that attracted your attention? Perhaps you thought for a moment that you could detect something, as if there was some kind of presence on the particular site that you could not really explain? Many people testify that they feel a strong affinity with nature all around us, that their strongest spiritual experiences are when they are moving through the forest.

This is not new of course. Humans have always had similar experiences since the origin of our species long, long ago. Through the ages, we have tried to understand and process these experiences, tried to portray them and give them shape, sought contact with the powers and the presence that we felt all around us. These experiences are the core of nature's religion.

Those of us who closely identify with these experiences exert a natural spirituality and seek a community that share in these gifts. That is the foundation of our community. We seek a harmony with nature and the gods based on ancient traditions and practices. We use the term "ancient" but that does not mean that our religion is obsolete or outdated. We reaffirm the old traditions and ways developed by the people who have gone before us, but develop them simultaneously, adapting them to our time and in the modern conditions under which we live. When we use the word "ancient", we may also allude to that it is rooted in a mythical time when our ancient ancestors lived in true harmony with the earth.

Our religion is polytheistic, meaning that we recognize and turn to a variety of gods and powers. Among these gods and goddesses include Odin, Freya, Thor, Sif and the others from the Norse mythology. Not all gods are Aesir - Freya is of the Vanir family, moreover, it is not just the gods and goddesses we turn but to nature spirits as the fey, animal totems, and so on. While we share a common religious foundation with the "Asatru", we understand that that this term is too narrow.

We recognize and celebrate these powers in rituals that we call blot. The blot can be considered as a symbolic celebration where we invite gods, goddesses and beings to participate, we offer them gifts and forming a relationship with them. A blot can be very simple and intimate but it can also be a big ceremony with many participants. Our festivals are tied to the seasons, and we are also ceremonies surrounding life's rites of passage such as weddings, funerals, naming of children, house blessings, and much more.
results.name: Wyrd Weavers
